With only a few steps, she was already standing in front of him. Saria kneeled down and took a better look at Link. "Hello Link!" He jumped back and layed paralyzed on his back. "H-h-how did you get so big, Saria?" Link stuttered with fear.

"I don't know exactly how I got so big. It was probably fate, I guess. I found this necklace in the Lost Woods. Isn't it beautiful?" "Link said, "It's wonderful. Now I have something to tell you. I am having difficulty getting further within the cavern. Navi read a tombstone that said, "In order to awaken the dead Dodongo, his eyes must flash red." I don't know exactly what it means. Do you?"

Saria pondered for a moment, then answered unsurely, "I'm not sure what you are talking about. I might want to check it out." Link still felt uncomfortable having a friend as a giant. He actually thought to himself if he really needed her help.
1131122212.title: Link's Big Helper

choices: Link says no. He must take on the boss himself to become a man.
Link agrees and lets her help him beat the boss.
11311222121.content:
Link drew to the conclusion that he really needed Saria's help. Her much taller body would be perfect for fending off enemies, he thought. "You can go inside the cavern with me and check it out." Saria jumped for joy, unaware that she sent Link jumping a little bit off the ground while doing this. "I'll do my best Link," Saria couldn't help but to let out her cheerful tone.

The cavern was the perfect size for Link. For Saria, however, it was like a rabbit hole that she just had to squeeze through. Her back touched the wall of the entrance of the cavern as she crawled through. It was rather uncomfortable, but Saria managed well. Before the two heroes was a square area of land surrounded by lava. Link navigated the square by stepping on other platforms. With Saria on his side, this will lead to more possibilities.

"Is it ok to stand up now?" Saria said while still crawling on all fours. "Sure, it's your body." Link replied. Saria stood up, then, CLONK! She hit her head on the wooden bridge that hanged just above her. "Ouch! I better be more careful next time," Saria rubbed her head, surprised that she would hit something. Lucky for her, she was only 5 feet away from hitting the ceiling. Link rolled his eyes while walking toward the pit of lava.

Link looked down into the pit. "Allow me to assist you." Saria picked Link up and placed him on her hand. All it took for her was one half stride just to get to the island in the middle of the pit. Link thought, "Wow, now I don't have to struggle with all that platforming." Saria's feet took up the whole platform, so she couldn't set Link down. Instead, she put him on her right shoulder.

Saria noticed the big head of the Dead Dodongo in front of her. Link talked into her ear. "This is the part I'm having trouble on. The dodongo is supposed to lead me to a new path if I can make his eyes red." Saria responded, "What new items did you pick up? Normally what you find is what's useful in a situation like this." Link's mind jumped with an idea, "Bombs!"

"Great idea Link! Could you please pass me a bomb?" Saria asked nicely. Link fetched a bomb from under his tunic and Saria held it with her two fingers. The bomb looked like a blue berry when she held it at her fingertips. She simply placed the bomb in one of its eyes and, BOOM!! It's eye turned red. Saria repeated the same process. One second later, both eyes were lit red. The jaw lowered, leading a new passageway.

Link thanked Saria, "Thank you! If it wasn't for you, I wouldn't have ever figured that out. You can be of great use to me on this trip." "You're very welcome Link! Do you want me to help you even further?"
11311222121.title: All it took were bombs?

choices: She cried, not meaning to harm that poor lizard.
She actually felt great about defeating the Dodongo King.
113112221212.content:
"I would be more than honored to help you out further." Saria said with a positive smile. Link nodded his head, knowing that he shouldn't let a good arsenal go to waste. She set him down inside the Dead Dodongo's jaw, while she tried to scrunch in. Saria was amazing. Even as a giantess, she fit through that tight opening with ease. From that point on, Saria had no choice but to crawl on all fours. The ceiling was just above her by a few inches.

As Saria kept crawling, she felt like the ground was going to collapse. Link felt the same thing, too. Suddenly, Saria's tremendous weight broke through the floor. Link was screaming at the top of his lung's. Saria was able to catch him in mid-air and she landed on the ground safely.

A square arena greeted Saria and Link. The land was a doughnut of earth and a filling of lava. A big lizard awaited them on the other side of the room. It looked enormous compared to Link. But to Saria, it looked like a mere dog that only went up to her waist. "Aww, what a cute animal." cooed Saria. "Don't let your guard down, Saria!" Link yelled while on her shoulder.

The lizard rolled over to Saria, but she easily pushed it away. The Dodongo King was bashed against the wall, stunned for a few moments. "Poor thing. I hope I didn't hurt him. I'll give him 5 of these weird berries to make him feel better." Saria picked up the weird looking berries, and walked toward the Dodongo. It sucked them up like a vacuum, trying to suck up Saria in the process, but she was too big for him. The big lizard blew up a second later. "Hmm, that's strange."

A heart container flew out of him and Link was able to catch it, just by sitting on Saria's shoulder. "Using those bomb plants was a good idea for beating that boss." cheered Link with confident joy. Saria felt weird within her, strangely.
113112221212.title: Dodongo Doggy?

choices: Darunia gives Link the Goron Ruby.
Darunia refuses at first, but Saria easily convinced him.
1131122212121.content:
Link smiled, until he noticed that Saria sniffled a little bit. "What's wrong Saria? We just beat the Dodongo King!" Saria placed him on the floor, and kneeled down. Link noticed a waterfall full of tears crashing downwards. Her eyes were drenched with those waterdrops, slowly rolling down her cheeks. Link hated to see her cry like that. "I didn't mean to destroy that harmless creature. It's not like me to kill something that is misunderstood."

"What you did was a good thing, Saria. The Dodongo King caused problems for the Goron race by eating all of their prime sirloin rocks. That big lizard was nothing more than a minion of Ganondorf." Saria wiped off the tears from her soft cheeks, and said, "Now I feel much better now. Zelda sent me on this mission, for the sole purpose of stopping Ganondorf. I'm glad this deed was of some help to you." Saria stopped crying once and for all and a calm grin showed a more pleased Kokiri.

The two saw the light blue portal that would help them escape the dungeon. Saria picked Link up again and put him on her right shoulder. She walked into the portal. It instantly took the two heroes back to the entrance of the Dodongo cavern. The two were confronted by the leader of the Gorons, Darunia.
1131122212121.title: I Didn't Mean to...

choices: They continue forth to the top of Death Mountain.
11311222121212.content:
"Ahh Yes! The Dodongo Cavern is finally restored to its rightful condition. Now the Gorons won't starve to death no longer." Darunia told the two with utmost gratitude. He had his eyes closed most of the time, until he opened them and noticed something very unusual. "Wow! Link, I never knew that you had a giant girlfriend to help you on your task. I guess I will have to refrain on giving you my prize." Link argued, "But that's not fair, we were in this together. Can I please have it?"

Darunia barked, "NO! You didn't prove yourself to be a man, Link. I can tell that this girl helped you the whole time. I can easily feel the ground around me, and heard a much bigger presence fending off the huge foe." Saria talked to the Goron leader, trying to convince him, "If you don't, I will do something that will make you tick!" "Oh? Like what?" Saria giggled, as she pulled out her fairy ocarina, "Like, this!"

Saria played her own song and Darunia felt a twitchy beat in his feet. "Ooohh! Yeah! Hot beat! Good music! Ooooh! Yeah!" After a few minutes, Saria stopped and Darunia stopped dancing as well. "Man, that song gets me every time. How did you know my secret, giant girl?" "Let's say that a little bird told me," Saria responded with happiness.

"Ok, in honor of having new allies, I will entrust you two with the Goron's Ruby. Take care on your journey, Link. And you too, big girl." "My name is Saria! Just to let you know for next time. Where do we go next?" Darunia looked up at her, giving his firm response, "Scale further atop of Death Mountain, and Link will learn a new technique. You, Saria will meet a friend on your way up. Farewell you two." With Link on Saria's shoulder once more, they both waved good bye as they walked a little bit up the mountain.
11311222121212.title: A Song to Soothe the Savage Goron

choices: Link visiting the fountain to obtain his ability.
Saria greeting Biggoron and having a nice little chat.
113112221212121.content:
With another spiritual stone under their belt, Saria and Link went forth on their quest. The climb up the Mountain was no problem for Saria. She simply lifted one foot up after the other. She reached the final stretch that would lead them to the summit of the mountain. Saria told Link, "I'm glad that the volcano isn't erupting right now." Link talked into her ear that was covered with fine green hair, "So am I. We are almost there."

Saria walked up to the steepest part of the mountain. She was able to reach her hands to the summit above her. Her hands grabbed the ledge of the top and simply moved her feet up the vertical wall. Saria used all of her upper arm strength to safely reach the top of the summit without knocking off Link. Saria was on her knees, so she put Link down on the floor. She stood up again, feeling tall and could see all of Hyrule. Her heighth plus the heighth of the mountain made a great view for her.

To Link's left appears to be a mysterious fountain. To the right of Saria, a big creature, known as Biggoron lived atop of the mountain. The massive rock giant stood up and waved to Saria.

Which perspective do you want to go from here?
113112221212121.title: A Fork in Perspectives

choices: Link tries to get Saria's attention.
11312.content:
Looking in the distance Saria could spot a horse running across the field. Being someone who never leaves the forest Saria was intrigued by the horse. Link was riding across the field on Epona his faithful horse. Turning his head toward the west quickly pulled the reigns on his horse quickly. As the horse stopped Link eyes quickly widened as he saw Saria in the distance.She was humongous compared to everything else.

"Saria" Link yelled in her direction. Saria probably didn't hear or notice him because she reached down toward Link and grabbed Epona. Link was thrown off due to the shock. Saria lifted Epona up to her face cradling her in her hand.

"Well aren't you cute?" Saria said softly as she stroke the horse's head with her finger. She then set Epona back on the field.
11312.title: Horsey!

choices: Shoot a light arrow past her face.
Hookshot her belt and climb up too her face.
113121.content:
Link gets up off the ground. Epona's back on the ground. He looks back up to see if Saria was still huge. Not that surprising she was still giant sized.

"I guess I wasn't dreaming." Link said. Saria wasn't looking at him. from the looks of it Saria probably didn't know he was there. Stepping out of the forest Saria walk onto Hyrule field, nearly stepping on Link in the process.

"Saria! Watch where you walk." Link said running out of the way. Saria could hear a faint squeak but couldn't understand it. Link saw that Saria stopped walking and started looking around in confusion.

"I guess she can't hear me." Link said staring at Saria in the distance. She was so large that her body casted a very large shadow. Link knew he had to get her attention but from the looks of it it wouldn't be easy.
113121.title: Seeking attention.

1131212.content:
Link quickly donned his hookshot and latched on too her belt. Just as he did this Saria decided to start walking south. Link was dragged toward her belt. This caused him to crash into her back but he luckily got a firm grasp on Saria's shirt.

He started his climb up her back Saria's walking made it difficult to properly climb.

"Where's she going anyway?" Link asked himself. Looking around he could see the familiar surroundings of...
1131212.title: Mt. Saria

choices: Saria decides to explore Hyrule more.
Link notices something strange about the necklace.
11312121.content:
Saria was standing at the edge of the of Lake Hylia. Of course in comparison to the giant girl it was the size of a small pond as opposed to the massive lake it was. Link had finally reached Saria's shoulders, he could hardly believe how huge she was up close.

"Hey Saria!" Link yelled in the direction of her ears. Saria didn't react at all. She apparently wasn't paying attention to anything but the sights she was looking at.

"SARIA!" Link screamed as loud as he could. Saria heard that and began looking around for whoever yelled her name. As she turned her head to look around her hair knocked Link off her shoulders. While falling Link reached for the nearest thing he could grab. He managed to grab Saria's new necklace like a rope.

"I guess I had a lucky break." Link said hanging from the necklace.
11312121.title: Link's lucky break.

113121212.content:
While hanging from the necklace Link noticed something strange. Saria had never had or even worn the necklace before today. Link also saw that a bright green jewel was glowing on the necklace.

"This thing looks like it maybe the problem." Link thought to himself. He began to climb up the necklace and sat down on top of the green jewel. Looking up at Saria to see what she was up to (really bad pun!) he could see she was still searching for who ever called her name.

"Hello?" she said. He loud deep voice echoed across the lake. She even began to search the ground to see if any tiny people had called he. She never bothered to check her necklace. Saria's movement caused some rocks to break and her foot steps caused tremors which caused major damage to the surrounding area.

"This has to be stopped." Link said to himself as he picks up his sword ready to destroy the jewel.
113121212.title: Link's necklace theory.

1131212121.content:
Link jams his mighty sword into the jewel shattering it into pieces. Saria immediately saw the flash of light as well as Link falling. Acting quickly she caught Link in her hand. She brought Link up to her eye level.

"Link why did you break my necklace?" Saria asked.

"That thing is what made you so large." Link said in his defense.

"I know but I like being big!" Saria said smiling. She obviously lie the face being bigger than everyone else.

"You were endangering innocent people and destroying property. And can we continue this conversation on the ground please?" Link asked as Saria gently set him on the ground.

Just then Saria's body began to glow a bright blue-ish light. Saria began to shink. As the glowing became brighter the shrinking became faster. When she shrank back to normal size the glowing ceased.

Saria looked around for Link but for some reason he wasn't there when she was back normal size. When she was about to give up she felt a little tap on her shoe.

Quickly looking down she couldn't help but stare. Link was standing next to her foot no taller than her ankle.Saria smiled with glee as she grabbed the tiny Link in her hand.

"Well even if I cant be bigger than everyone anymore at least I can always be bigger than one person." She said as she pat the miniature Link on his head.

"Don't worry I'll take good care of you and as always will be best friends forever." She said as she left the lake on her way home, holding the broken necklace in one hand and Link in the other.
1131212121.title: Not exactly the way planned.

choices: Saria busts out of the house
Link and Saria spend a little time talking to each other
1132.content:
Saria shrugged. "Ah well, I suppose it is rather nice." She headed back towards her house. Link was waiting for her. In truth she had a bit of a crush on him. She blushed a little. "Hi Link."
"Hi Saria. Can I talk to you for a minute?"
Inside her, she screamed with delight. On the outside:
"Okay, can we go back to my house?"
"Sure." They walked in silence until Saria was settled on her bed and Link was relaxed in a chair. "So?" she asked. "What do you want to speak to me about?"
"Uh, Saria, this is, um, rather hard to talk about. Um...Saria..." All at once Saria felt the same pain she had felt when putting on the necklace. She didn't wince but listened. His voice seemed to be getting quieter. And this bed was rather uncomfortable. It seemed to be getting more and more uncomfortable.
"Um..Saria, would you...would you be my girlfriend please?" Link's urgency to ask made Saria smile. She opened her mouth to say yes but Link suddenly gasped.
"Saria, get up!"
"Why Link?" She did as she was told and then realised that Link was now half her size. She was growing. Saria tugged on the necklace but it refused to move. She proceeded to get bigger, and bigger, and bigger....
And then she stopped. She'd grown so much that her body was blocking the doorway so neither her nor Link could get out.
1132.title: Pop the question

choices: Link goes outside to get help.
Link stays and tries to get Saria outside.
11322.content:
"So umm.. hows are things going." Saria said trying to ignore the fact she was so large her head pressed against the ceiling. Link could only stare at first. The girl he just asked to be his girlfriend had just grown humongus.

"Saria how can you be so calm about this?" Link asked her. Saria just smiled either she was in denial or it really didn't bother her. Link watched her struggle for about a minute.

"Uhh.. Link I don't think I can get out." Saria told him as she continued to try to break a wall or the ceiling. She was big but not big enough to break down the house.

"You'll have to get out and get help for me." Link looked at the entrance to the house. Saria's back was covering it completly.

"I can't your back is blocking the way out." Link said. Saria moved her back from the entrance. Link could see daylight from the outside.
11322.title: Something to talk about.

113222.content:
Link pushed and strained but it was no use. Saria was stuck. And Link couldn't squeeze past her either. Then Saria spoke.

"Oh, by the way, yes, I'll be your girlfriend, Link."

There was a silence. Then...

"It feels kind of wierd for my best friend and girlfriend to be more than twice my size."
"Oh, I know," she said, laughing.
"What are your thoughts about this?"
"...I think it's all right. It's pretty cool being big."
"Yeah...I suppose it is."
"Something the matter, Link?"
Link felt a bit uncomfortable both physically and mentally. He didn't say anything.
Then Link noticed something. "Hey, I don't recognise that necklace."
"No, someone gave it to me. A Skull Kid."
"Oh, right." Link felt as if Saria had already betrayed him. Saria thought to herself, "I wonder what the stone in the necklace feels like." And she stroked the stone.
113222.title: "I always knew that Skull Kid was up to no goo

choices: See if she can get any bigger with the necklace
1132221.content:
Almost immediately Saria began to grow again. Link screamed as she began to take up all the space. Then...

BANG!!
The roof was off and Saria was towering above them all, about 20 ft. So this was what the necklace did! Saria felt a bit uncomfortable so she ran out of the forest, and thought about what to do next.
1132221.title: They don't grow older, but they sure grow big

11322211.content:
Saria examined the remains of her house. Sure enough Link was still alive. Link opened his eyes to see Saria's giant face staring back down at him.

"Are you okay?" Saria asked him. Now standing up he could see she nearly doubled in size.

"I'm fine just promise you'll stop touching that necklace." Link asked her gently. She looked at the necklace around her neck.

"Fare enough." Saria said almost laughing at the fact she broke her own house. She took off the necklace and dropped it below. As the necklace fell it shrank back down to normal size. Link caught it and put it away. Saria then picked up Link and placed him on her shoulder.

"So where are we going?" Saria asked him.
11322211.title: Link's giant Girlfriend.

113222111.content:
Right after Link said "Lon Lon Ranch" Saria ran as fast as she could out of the forest. As soon as she left the forest Link told her what the ranch was. as the entered the vicinity of the ranch Link jumped off Saria's shoulder.

"Wait right here." Link told her as he went into the house. A minutes later Link came out with Malon following closely behind him. Malon gasped when she saw the giant girl looking down at her.

"Malon this is my girlfriend Saria." Link said. Malon was shocked not only because Link had a girlfriend but that Saria was a 20ft girl.

"Are all girl's this tall where you come from fairy boy?" Malon said curious about Saria's height.

"Well" Link said holding up Saria's necklace. "This thing made her grow so tall." Link said showing Malon the necklace.

"Can I see it please?" Malon asks nicely. Link was conflicted on what to say.
113222111.title: Can I see it?

choices: Saria gets jealous and uses the necklace to grow.
Malon and Saria decide to go elsewhere.
1132221111.content:
"Well maybe for a little bit." Link said handing over the necklace. Malon was so fascinated by it she just had to try it on.

"Wait Malon you didn't say you were going to put it on!" Link said nervously. Malon continued to put it on when she was finished she felt a shrp pain in her chest just like Saria did when she first tried it on.

"Uh-oh." Link and Saria both said in unison. Malon's body started to expand until she was the same size as Saria. With the growing stopped Malon looked confused with her new size until she saw Saria was the same height she then quickly figured this out.

"Oops" Malon said as she accidentally tripped causing her to crush the barn.
1132221111.title: Double Trouble.

choices: Malon is surprised at Saria's growth
Now Malon becomes jealous of Saria's height
11322211111.content:
In truth Saria really didn't have anything against Malon on a personal level, but a part of her didn't like the fact that Malon had just used her gift to increase her size and even match Saria in height.

Also not only did Malon grow in height, but now that she was bigger also meant her "assists" had grown to match her body and that worried Saria that perhaps Link would prefer Malon over her.

Deciding that she had to tower over the redhead Saria quickly snatches the necklace from around Malon's neck.

"Hey!" complains the redhead with a sudden pout on her lips.

"Sorry but this is mine, Malon."

Link quickly catches the slight anger in Saria's vocal tone, and he wonders what could be bothering her.

Readjusting it around her neck, Saria strokes the gem once more. Instantly Link's best friend turn girlfriend shoots up another 20 ft. now bringing the green-haired girl to 40 ft. in total, twice the size of Malon.
11322211111.title: Saria's growing jealously

choices: Saria manages to get ahold of Link.
113222111111.content:
"Why me?" Link thought as he stood staring at the now larger Saria. Malon was a bit shocked when she saw Saria's intimidating frame even though Malon was physically older than Saria.

"Saria did you do that just so you could become bigger than me?" Malon asked. Saria didn't reply because she had her eyes locked on Link who she had really done it for. She reached her hand down and tried to pick Link up.

"Stop it Saria." Link said as her ran away from Saria's hand. Malon quickly grasped Saria's wrist to aid Link's escape. Malon also had feelings for Link maybe they wern't as strong as Saria's but they were in her top 5. He was more like her brother than her boyfriend so she felt the need to step in the way.

"Leave him alone." the redhead said with fire in her eyes. Saria easily shook her wrist free and pushed Malon to the ground.

"This doesn't concern you." Saria said while continuing to chase Link.
113222111111.title: Love Obsessed

1132221111112.content:
Knowing she couldn't stall Saria, Malon had a new plan. She quietly hinted to Link to hide near her boots. When he approached she picked him up as quickly, yet gently as possible, and placed him in her pocket before Saria could get him. "Give me back me boyfriend." Saria shouted at the Redhead, but Malon held her ground and simply looked at the Kokiri with a serious face. "If you really loved him that much you would notice that he's frightened. He didn't want you to try to grab him, yet you kept on persisting and didn't even notice that your obsession as well as your size not only intimidated him, it terrified him. Just look at him." Malon shouted as she carefully took Link out of her pocket.
Saria...
1132221111112.title: Defending her hero

choices: Saira takes Link to another location.
Malon regains control of the necklace.
11322211111122.content:
Without much thought Link was quickly snatched out of Malon's fingers. She was completely oblivious to Malon's plea for sanity.

"Link are you alright?" Saria asked ignoring the fact here hand were squeezing him in a most uncomfortable manner.
She was holding his body tightly in her hand, and was unaware of how rough it was for him.

Meanwhile Malon watched as the much larger Saria cuddled Link in here hands. It was embarrassing to see someone as mature a Saria act like that. Malon just could stay quiet any longer.

"Saria let Link down, your just frightening him." Malon pleaded. Malon just watched as the giant green-haired girl started to coo Link.

"Oh Link! I'm in love with you! Let’s get married!" Saria said calmly. Link's faced turned white the thought of a normal marriage would make him uneasy, but this situation really shook him up. It was official Saria had completely lost her mind.
11322211111122.title: Saria's lost it.

choices: Link finds a way to turn them back to normal
113222111111222.content:
"I can see it now. A wedding under the great Deku Tree or our special place in front of the forest temple. Yes that would be perfect."
As Saria continued to fantasize, her "hug" was suffocating Link. She had already managed to crush his longshot to a small ball of metal when he tried to escape and his shield literally snapped in half from the pressure.

Suddenly something flew through the air and hit haria in the face. The shock caused Saria to drop Link. As he prepared for a hard painful landing his fall was cut short by a soft surface. Looking up he saw that it was Malon's dress being held out to catch Link. After looking around he noticed that the thing that hit Saria was one of Malon's boots.

"You little. I'll kill you!" Saria shouted. "Now how do you plan to do that, Shorty?" Malon said almost like she was teasing Saria. " 'Shorty'? You seem to be forgetting something." Saria said as she rubbed the necklace to demonstrate. But something was wrong. Saria didn't grow. When she looked she noticed that the necklace was gone. "Looking for this?" Malon said showing that she was wearing the necklace. After stroking it a few times she shot up passing Saria's height.

Saria looked up in fear. "Now you're afraid of me. Why is that? Is it mabey how BIG I AM?" Malon shouted trying to show Saria just how scared Link was. Saria began to whimper as the farm girl now towered over her.
113222111111222.title: Role Reversal

choices: The girls shrink but not fully
1132221111112221.content:
As Saria began to cower under Malon. Link noticed something on the stone. After inspecting he realized that it was an inscription. "Only the winds can stop the rampage." Beneth were some strange looking marks that looked familiar somehow.

"Of course!" Link realized. "They're music notes. I need the ocrena." Pulling out his instrument he called up to Malon. "I think I found a way to turn you 2 back to normal." Malon responded, "Great this thing has gotten WAY out of hand." Glad that she wouldn't stop him, Link played the notes inscribed on the necklace.

After playing the song......
1132221111112221.title: What DOESN'T it do?

choices: Malon tries to restore Link with the necklace
11322211111122212.content:
When saria looked up again she noticed that something was differant. "You...you're not so big anymore." She said nervously. "Link found a way to get us back to normal since you went crazy from that thing." Malon explained. "Speaking of which, where is Fairy Boy?" she asked herself.

The answer came fast when she looked down and noticed a doll-sized hero of time hanging on to her dress. "Uhoh. Looks like you shrank too." Malon said as she picked him up.
11322211111122212.title: So close yet so far

choices: Saria is still just as love obsessed as before.
113222111111222122.content:
While Saria threw a mini-tantrum about not being a giant anymore, Malon picked up the necklace which had fallen on the ground. She held the necklace close to Link, who attempted to use it to return to normal size. However it failed to glow like in any of it's previous uses.

"Looks like I'm stuck like this!" Link said before letting out deep sigh. He purposely fell flat on his back and stared at Malon's giant face. She stared back at him and frowned. She really wanted to help him return to normal size, after all it was partially her fault this whole mess happened, but what could she due she knew next to nothing about magic or enchanted jewelry.

"Maybe I could take you to someone who could help you?" Malon suggested, "There might be someone who knows the means to restore you." Link just sat up and gave Malon a smile. Just as this warm moment occurred Saria approached the two.

The question was has she come to her senses?
113222111111222122.title: Seeking a Remedy

choices: Zelda grows to the same size as Saria and Malon.
Link grabs the necklace and takes it off her.
11322211112.content:
Saria and Malon began to skip off. "Hey!" Link said, riding on Epona, and trying to keep up (without success.) But they just ignored him and ran faster. Soon Link had no choice but to give up. "So much for my girlfriend." Link shook himself and rode after them. "I won't give up! I want to see what they'll get up to!" Link had a bad feeling about this. First Saria, now Malon. This could be bad...

Meanwhile, the pair of mini-giants were near Hyrule castle when they saw Zelda taking a walk. She noticed them. "Hey! Why are you two so big?" she asked. Just then Link caught up. "It's this necklace." Saria said. "Well, give it to me then. I'd like to see it."
"Zelda, no!"
"Link, please be quiet."

Zelda took the necklace and put it on.
11322211112.title: Did Zelda just say that to Link?!!

113222111122.content:
Link quickly dove at Zelda and managed to take the necklace off her as well as topple her over.

"Link why did you do that?" Zelda said pushing Link off her. Zelda was furious at Link action.

"Zelda! This thing is dangerous. It caused both Saria and Malon to grow huge it's just to dangerous." Link said getting up off the ground. Saria and Malon could only watch as Zelda tried to take the necklace off of Link. Of course Link thought of nothing but destroying the thing. So he donned his mighty megaton hammer and smashed the thing to pieces.

"No!" All three girls said at once. The necklace was broken. But neither Saria nor Malon changed at all they were still humongous.

"Yay! I'm still big." Saria said jumping up and down causing everyone but Malon to fall over. Malon wasn't as happy as Saria but she still was pleased. Just then the necklace suddenly reformed itself. The only thing different about the necklace was that the gem was a different color.

When Link started to approach it Zelda put her foot out and tripped him. Quickly snatching the necklace of the ground she put it on and the stone started glow again.
113222111122.title: The Broken Necklace

choices: Zelda gives the necklace to both of them, and they grow to her size
Zelda is too selfish to share
1132221111221.content:
Link tried to grab for it again, but only this time Zelda evaded him. She was already beginning to grow. The three giantesses had evil grins on their faces. But Zelda didn't stop growing when she reached the other two's size. In fact she grew until she was twice as large as the other two.

"Wow!" Saria said, out loud. "Smashing it must make the effects more powerful!"

"Well, I want to be as big as Zelda then," Malon said."
1132221111221.title: If it's mended, don't do it again

choices: Saria and Malon try to tackle Zelda.
11322211112212.content:
"Hey Zelda give us the necklace." Saria said trying to take the necklace off the giant Princess. Zelda just ignored this it seemed that she was to selfish to share her prize.

"Give it back to Saria!" Malon said trying to help Saria get the necklace back. The Two girls tried to get it off of Zelda. Unfortunately Zelda's bigger bulk gave her an advantage. Link could only watch as the three girls fight over the necklace while trying to avoid being killed by their shoes.

"It's mine!" Zelda said. Sweeping her leg across the ground causing Saria and Malon to trip and fall. Both girls gave Zelda a evil look.
11322211112212.title: Selfish Princess

choices: Malon and Saria break the necklace.(again)
Zelda topples the two and steals it back.
113222111122121.content:
Both Saria and Malon prepared to attack Zelda. They both tried to simultaneously tackle her at once. This plan was successful as Zelda fell to the ground destroying part of the castle in the process. Saria and Malon proceeded to pin Zelda to the ground.

"I'll take this thank you very much." Saria said to the giant princess as she proceeded to take the necklace from Zelda. Saria took a good look at the necklace. Before Saria could stare at it any longer Malon grabbed the other end of the necklace.

"Malon what are you doing?" Saria asked tugging on the necklace.

"I want to use it first." Malon yelled also tugging on her half of the necklace. The two continued to fight as Link could only helplessly watch. Meanwhile Zelda was prepared to strike down the two mini giantesses and take the necklace herself.
113222111122121.title: IT'S MINE!

choices: Link tries to destroy it once more
The girls, or at least one of them, spots him
113222111122122.content:
"Oh man...I knew this was going to happen...darn it!" Link grumbles to himself as he watches the two "smaller" giantess struggle to relive Zelda of the necklace.

"Okay, time to take matters into my own hands...again..."

Thinking quickly Link reaches into his pockets and pulls out a pair of deku nuts (he had them saved for just such an emergency), tossing them far into the air he proceeds to use his boomerang to smash them just as they reached the vision points of the girls.

The blinding pair of flashes works well and for a moment neither girl can see a thing. Once again thinking quickly Link uses his Longshoot to get him to at least Zelda's waist (in truth The Longshot could travel great distance but even Zelda's height was too much for it).

While Zelda and the other girls were still blinded, Link attaches himself firmly on Zelda's waist, it was almost as if he was climbing a mountain, using a good deal of his strength and focus Link then sends his trusty boomerang into the air once more in hopes it would snag the necklace around Zelda's slender neck.

Fate once again seems to work in Link's favor as the boomerang successfully removes the necklace from Zelda's neck, thus bringing it back to normal size.

Taking it into his gloved hand, Link detaches himself from Zelda and uses the Longshot to land safety on the ground necklace still in hand.
113222111122122.title: Clever Link

1132221111221222.content:
Link sighs in relief, thankful that his plan worked and now he could finally find a way to destroy this strange necklace.

"Leave it to a Skullkid to find the darnest of things..." he mumbles to himself, suddenly notices a large shadow eclipse over him.

"Uh oh..." turning quickly, Link notices it is Saria who is towering over him.

"Saria?" "Did you forget Link since I'm a Kokiri my eyesight recovers a lot faster from Deku Nuts then others."

Link nods for a moment, "Oh yeah...guess I forgot." Now the young hero tries his best to hide the necklace from his enlarged best friend/girlfriend.

Taking quick note of what he's trying to do, Saria crouches down to her knees.

"Give me the necklace, Link." she demands yet surprisingly there isn't any force behind her words. Saria then takes a moment to stare back at the still blinded Zelda and Malon.

"Link, please you must hand me the necklace before they regain their eyesight."

"I..I can't do that Saria..." a look of depression cross his facial features, "This thing is dangerous it has to be destroyed."

"I know that now...I was a fool to be intoxicated by it's power. I'll help you as best I can, but right now I need it to match Zelda's height. At my current height Zelda can easily stop the both of us." Clasping her hands together Saria begs for Link's assistance.

"Please Link, I promise I won't let the power get to me." Link stares for a moment before a sigh leaves his lip, yet a short grin plays on said lips.

"Alright I trust you, Saria, so here catch." Tossing the necklace into the air Saria skillfully catches it.

She then proceeds to place it around her neck.

"Thanks Link." Saria smiles for moment before stroking the gem once more.
1132221111221222.title: Saria regains the necklace

1132221111222.content:
Zelda cheers silently as she places the necklace around her neck. But unlike the girls before her, Zelda does not experience a slight ping in her chest area.

Instead her body begins to glow a strong crimson (to match the new color of the necklace's gem).

Link, Saria, and Malon stare with full curiosity the same thought running through their heads.

"What's going to happen to Zelda?"

The trio get their answer half a minute as a bright flash blinds them all for a moment or two. Upon regaining their vision, Link is the first to notice that well...he can't seem to notice Zelda. Where was she?

"Link, look there!" Saria points to the necklace that lays on the ground. Curious Link proceeds to lift it off the pavement and to his (as well as the girl's) amazement he finds a very tiny Zelda passed out on the stone floor.

But just how small was Zelda? Was a question that ran through Link's mind.
1132221111222.title: No growth for Zelda

1132221112.content:
"Malon, I am very sorry, but one Giantess is good enough." Link said returning the Magical Necklace to his Bag. Malon looked really depressed. "But, how would you like to go see the Princess with us?" Saria suggested. "Sure!" Malon said, suddenly delighted. "Saria, she might try to get the necklace from my bag." Link said quickly deducing on what Malon could be thinking.

Saria solved the entire problem, by slipping Link's Bag, containing the Necklace, in her Boot. Saria then picked Malon up, and set her on her shoulder, opposite to the one Link was on, and set off.
1132221112.title: Trip to the Castle

choices: Malon dares Saria to get even bigger (so Saria does)
11322212.content:
Saria stroked the stone again. It glowed and Saria shot up again. She was about 70 ft now. Saria was beginning to like this newly found power. She began stroking the stone over and over again until she was 500 ft tall. And then she decided to play a joke on one of her friends. She turned and headed toward Lon Lon Ranch.

Malon was busy taking care of the milk, but when sudden tremors made the milk fall over she was angry. That anger faded away as she saw a giant of a Kokiri looming over her. "Boo."

How does Malon react?
11322212.title: Necklace of Power

113222122.content:
"Wow! Is that you Saria?!" called out Malon as she stared up at the giantess. "Yup its all me." said Saria cheerfully.

"But how did you get so big, and I mean big?" Malon was really confused as to how the kokiri that was about four feet tall the last time she saw her was now 500 ft tall.

"Well it was this necklace, actually." Saria then bended down slightly to show off her newest jewelry. "Hey thats pretty, I'm jealous." said Malon with a mock pout. Saria merely giggled at her "tiny" friend.

"Anyway...I got an idea." "What is it, Malon?" asked Saria with a head tilt. "How about you get even bigger. You know like really BIG!" Malon giggled as she imagined Saria getting so big that only her feet would be visible.

"So how about it?" dared Malon. "Well...I'm not sure if I'll ever be able to return to my normal height...but oh heck I'll do it." "Yeah!" cheered Malon as jumped with joy.
113222122.title: Malon's dare

choices: She wonders how big she can get.
She wonders how she is going to eat.
1132221221.content:
Saria started stroking the necklace yet again and shot up instantly to a thousand feet. Malon keeps on daring Saria to keep stroking the necklace until all of Hyrule could see Saria.

Giggling Saria looks down (it's about a mile to the ground. Hmmmmmm.... wonder how the weather is up there?) and shouts, "How's this, Molan? Am I big enough?"

Molan just gapes and suddenly bursts into laughter. "Your feet are about a hundred feet long Saria!"

Saria starts to laugh with her and breaks every window in Hyrule.

Suddenly Saria gets an idea.
1132221221.title: Stroke Mania

choices: She needed to find how to reverse the growth to not harm her friends.
She didn't care if the growth couldn't be reversed, she wanted control.
11322212211.content:
A huge grin spreads over Saria's face. Malon (and most of Hyrule) could see the mischievous look on the giantess' face.

Malon looked (way) up to Saria and asked, "Saria... What are you thinking about?"

Saria looked around, seeing the now small land of Hyrule, thinking of her new found size, and what she could do with it.

"At this size," she thought, "Nothing could stop me, I could take over the kingdom of Hyrule in a hour, if not faster... and if I got even bigger...

Suddenly she felt a flash of guilt run through her.

"If I keep growing though" she pondered, 'I may just hurt all of those that I love... and I don't even know if I can reverse the affects of the growth..."

Malon... now agitated from Saria being so large, but doing nothing for so long screamed to her "Hey! Are you going to do anything Saria?"

Saria, troubled thought for a while and decided that...
11322212211.title: Thoughts About Growth

113222122112.content:
Saria thought about her life before she got the necklace, and realized that she never wanted to go back. At her old short stature she could physically amounted to nothing. Sure she wasn't exactly the shortest Kokiri, (but being taller then a guy who's so short he can't even look over a counter made for him is like saying you won the race ahead of the people who couldn't finish) but at that size she couldn't do anything to have her way. She couldn't stop Link from leaving the forest the first time, She couldn't even find the courage to follow him. But at this size... all was possible.

Saria looked down to Malon and proclaimed "Were going to have a little fun!"

She then reached down and picked up Malon, bringing her to eye level, and saw that to her, Malon was no bigger than an flea. She almost could not believe that less than an hour ago, she was about 4/5 her size. Doing a few calculations in her head, she figured she was now about 1,000 feet tall. The tallest building in the kingdom, Hyrule Castle, wouldn't even come up to her knee. She laughed to herself at the thought of Zelda's face if she would look out of her tower window and see only a giant pair of legs.

Saria put Malon on her shoulder and told her "Hang on, I don't want you to get lost on the ride!"

Saria then started to...
113222122112.title: Goodbye Shorty.

choices: She was about a mile high.
She was the same size, but Malon on the other hand...
1132221221121.content:
Saria closed her eyes as she quickly rubbed the stone. Soon she thought, she would be a mile high, her feet each measuring more than 600ft long, able to crush Hyrule Castle in a single step.

She ginned at the thought of growing even bigger before destroying the city and becoming ruler of Hyrule, growing to 50 miles high, her feet being more then twice the size of castle town. Her little toe being twice as high as death mountain, and the ability to grow even larger if she wished.

she rubbed the necklace in her hands for a few more moments, then opened her eyes to see...
1132221221121.title: Need for height.

choices: I suppose any bigger would be kinda frightening..."
11322212211211.content:
Looking outward, Saria could see all of Hyrule below her, her massive feet had crushed Malon's ranch, but from the joyous sounds besides her, she couldn't care less.

"Oh my gosh!" Malon yelled in delight. "You can see EVERYTHING from up here... I had no idea the gerudo desert was so big... and would you look over there! You can see the ocean past Lake Hylia! And look over there!..." looking over on her shoulder, Saria noticed Malon looked the same size to her as she had before she grew again... she started to giggle. If Malon had grown with her, she must now be a giant to normal people in her own right... but compared to Saria, she was no more significant then a bug.

"What's so funny?" Saria heard Malon ask. "Oh. Nothing." Saria laughed "I'm just thinking how cool it is to be so big... So, what now?" "Huh?" Malon said, confused. "Well, you wanted me to grow, and I'm just kinda wondering... is this big enough for you?" Saria joked. Malon, thought for a second, before responding "Well...
11322212211211.title: Mile High Fun

choices: She somehow had the power to summon a tree bigger than she is.
11322212212.content:
"Hmm... What am I going to eat now?" Saria questioned while putting her fingers under her chin. She was tired of standing, so she sat down. Saria wasn't used to being a behemoth, so she took up the majority of the ranch and collapsed the fence that was to the side of her.

Malon was amazed that she saw her face even closer. She really admired Saria's hair and beautiful blue eyes. Malon tried to answer her question, "You are always free to eat all of the horses and cows at the ranch." Saria disagreed, "Sorry, but I'm a vegetarian, and I wouldn't want to harm an innocent animal. It's not like me."

Saria sparked an idea in her mind, "I know! I will eat every tree in Hyrule!" Malon giggled, "I'd love to see you do that!" Saria saw a small tree on the ground and easily unrooted it with her two fingers. The tree was like a flower of broccoli in comparison to her. She popped the vegetation in her mouth, chewed a little bit, then swallowed. "Mmmm! Everything tastes good as a giant! I want to eat more!"

Saria's greedy appetite forced her to walk all around Hyrule, grabbing trees and forcing them into her mouth. She must've been eating enough to choke 100 elepants with every mouthful she took. After about 30 minutes, Hyrule was treeless. Malon saw the whole act from a distance. "That was amazing Saria. Too bad we will run out of oxygen soon."

"What's funny is that I'm not even full yet. It will take much more to satisfy my hunger." Saria rubbed her belly with a positive grin.

Something "Big" is going to happen next...
11322212212.title: Fiber Diet

choices: She climbs the tree to get an apple
She tries to out grow the tree
113222122122.content:
Malon could easily hear Saria's stomach gurggle with each passing second. "Man, you really are hungry." Malon said in amazement. Saria didn't answer back. But rather, radiated green energy around her. Her whole body glowed a light green, even her eyes brimmed with green energy. Malon started to get scared, not knowing what she could possibly do next.

Saria stood up tall and lifted her arms up as if heaving something from the ground. Brown roots shot up to the sky with a never ending growth of them. Each of the roots coiled together, continuing to form the gargantuan tree. At this rate, the tree towered over Saria by at least 5,000 feet. The amazing tree halted it's growth as soon as the branches and bushes of leaves formed in place. Malon looked like a microscopic organism compared to the godly tree. To Saria, it looked like her standard height, if she were to compare her old height to a regular tree.

"That was amazing! Can you do that again?" Malon told her with amazement. "I don't think that I can do something like that again. It is pretty amazing." Saria saw some apples up high and wants to eat one.
113222122122.title: The Forever Tree

choices: She starts to eat the fruit. Malon watched in amazement.
Saria puts Malon on top of the apple.
1132221221221.content:
"Gee! I'm still hungry, even when I ate every tree in Hyrule." Saria looked up at the tall tree, smiling with giddy warmth. She went up to the tree and started to climb it. Malon was greatly amazed at seeing a giant climb a giant. The tree reminded her of a beanstock that reached up high in the sky. She hoped that she wouldn't fall back and squish her and the beautiful Lon Lon Ranch.

Saria climbed the tower tree at a very quick rate. In 3 minutes, she climbed to the top of the tree, grabbed the gigantic apple, and fell to the ground. Malon's eyes bulged to the size of her body as she saw Saria's massive form make contact with the ground. One second. She touched the ground. No earthquake? No tremor that could send Hyrule in a rugged wasteland? Saria completely "Twinkle toes'd" that fall. Saria weighed about several hundred tons with her magnificent height.

"I'm surprised that you didn't crush my beautiful ranch," said Malon with a sigh of a relief. Saria was great with hearing, so she heard Malon fine. "Not only am I a giant, but I have sage-like powers. I am destined to be a sage 7 years into the future. I think that the great Deku Tree granted me the destiny to be Sage, ever since he gave birth to me."

Saria looked at the big apple in her hands. It looked exactly as if she'd hold a real-life apple, only it completely towers over Malon and Lon Lon Ranch all together. She placed the apple on the ground, next to Malon. She was amazed to look up at it. It was like James and the Giant Peach all over again. "That's an amazing fruit. You can easily earn a billion rupees at the county fair for that Saria. Aren't you going to eat it now?" Saria kneeled down, looking at the small Malon. "Well..."
1132221221221.title: Grabbing the Sacred Fruit

114.content:
(This chapter was originally written by a guest writer.)

It was a hot summers day in Hyrule, and the water in Zora's domain sparkled in the sun. Most of the Zoras were swimming to keep out of the intense heat. Except Princess Ruto. She was sent to feed Jabu-Jabu.

"Hmph," She said unhappily. "The hottest day of the year, and I'm stuck with this thankless job! I'm a sage! I shouldn't have to put up with this!" Ruto looked at the huge amount of fish she had to give to Jabu-Jabu. "Hmmm.." She said. "I am kinda hungry, and I'm sure he wouldn't notice if I took just one..." She quickly took one fish and ate it. "Not bad." She said. Just then, Ruto began to feel a bit strange. "I-I don't feel well!" She groaned. The world seemed to spin around her, and just then, everything went black.

Later, she woke up to discover...
114.title: How shall we start?

1142.content:
Ruto quickly kneeled at the water's edge and checked her reflection, there was nothing wrong with her. Maybe it was just a bad piece of fish? Well regardless it was a very hot day, so like anyone in her situation would do she jumped in the water to cool off.

"I wonder how deep reservoir is?" she thought. In her entire life she had never touched the bottom of the reservoir. What better day than a really hot day to try, right? It only took her three minutes to reach the bottom not really a challenge for a Zora. Just as she reached the bottom Ruto felt that same sensation as before.

“I feel weird again." she said to herself. So she swam back to the surface to rest. When she reached the surface she gasped when she realized...
1142.title: Quick Swim

choices: She begins to abuse her height
11421.content:
That she had doubled in height.

"But I can't be a giant! I will never be able to rule the Zoras if I am a giant freak."

She was about to cry, but when she took a couple of steps, she began to smile.

"I feel like a god with this body, I feel happy..."

Ruto took a dive into Lake Hylia and managed to reach the bottom of the lake within a minute. Ruto felt proud of her new height, as if she could do anything now.

As Ruto returned to shore and admired her new body, she began to change once again.
11421.title: ...she had doubled in height.

11511.content: Let us begin shall we? But who shall begin? Cia or Lana? Could there be a more obvious choice?
11511.title: Hyrule Warriors

choices: Yes, let’s see the “real legendary hero”
No no, I want to see Lana
115112.content: Are you sure you want to go with Lana? There’s still everyone’s favourite technically not a gender bend character: Linkle!
115112.title: There’s one more warriors girl!

choices: Use this new power to help her friends! (Reserved)
1151121.content:
It was a seemingly normal summer day in the kingdom of hyrule when suddenly, a message from the royal guardsmen came in from the Faron woods, alerting the people of hyrule castle that monsters were attacking the land once again. Impa was of course the first to hear these news, however with link and Zelda gone fighting off in the eldin caves, and Lana and cia going back to the valley of seers, she would have to settle for a squadron of whoever she could find. Impa ran around the town looking for anyone that looked like they could put up a fight. In the end, she had assembled quite the random assortment of team members, those members being one of the local store owners: Ravio. A proud and well renowned Goron soldier: Darunia. As well as the young girl who believed she was the legendary hero and had helped protect the town from total ruin: Linkle. This rag-tag crew was truly impas only option, so with sword in hand, Impa and her soldiers rushed out towards Faron woods, along with a few new faces.

“How much longer so we have to walk, Impa?” Linkle said in a whiny tone “my feet are killing me!” She added. “We will walk as long as we need to, we have to save the people in the woods, you call yourself a hero right? Act like one” Impa replied sternly “right, right, sorry... it’s just, being the legendary hero is hard work!” Linkle said, getting a little more cheer in her voice. The team had been walking for hours on end, as most of the horses they had back at the castle were severely injured after the battle with ganon, and so they all headed towards the woods in the sun on foot. Most of them were wearing there usual attire, with Impa sporting her armour, Ravio having on his trademark pink bunny costume and Darunia seemingly wearing nothing. However Linkle decided to change up her attire slightly for the mission, wearing her same green hood with her grandmothers compass, but wearing much shorter boots while having her dual crossbows strapped to her back instead. She didn’t much like this way of storing her weapons, however Impa had told her it was more practical, and so just this once, Linkle had on normal sized boots, leaving much more of her legs bare.
“You know, if you’d like, I can sell you this water bottle for only 10 rupees!” Ravio said to Linkle from behind “are you really trying to sell our water to our own troops?” Impa asked “I’ll have you know I brought this water from home, and this is a prime opportunity for profit, of course, the bottles need to be returned afterwards” he said. Impa simply sighed and stopped paying attention to him. Linkle always thought Ravio was kind of funny, but he really reminded her of somebody for some reason, she brushed off the though after something on the side of the rode caught her attention. It was some sort of shiny thing, and she really wanted to have it. She separated herself from the group momentarily and went towards it, only to find it was some sort of blue crystal “oooh, pretty!” She exclaimed as she shoved it in her pocket, not knowing the power it held.

After a few more hours of walking in the hot summer sun, Linkle, Impa and everyone else had arrived at the woods, everyone ridiculously tired, hot and drenched in sweat. As they arrived they could immediately hear fighting going on in the forest, it would seem this raid was being lead by the dragon knight of eldin caves: Volga, he had been searching many days for a worthy challenger, and a mysterious vision had told him that a woman with enough power to defeat him would appear in these very woods, he would use this opportunity to finally combat somebody worthy, and to do so he had to lure whoever it was out with this attack. A few bokoblin scouts had noticed Impa’s party and ran quickly back to their master. “So... a sheikah knight and some cucco farmer are my only two options? Well then, send several units to attack, but don’t harm those two, it wouldn’t be a fair fight!” He commanded, and his troops followed his orders by immediately charging out of their own keep and heading for our heroes base. It didn’t take long before one of the goron captains Darunia had brought along noticed the all out attack on the allied base, he headed back and reported straight to Impa and the other captains. “So the dragon knight is leading this attack? This shouldn’t prove to be to much of a problem if he only has bokoblins and lizalfos on his side, however, Volga is an extremely powerful man.I suggest we stay in groups just in case somebody runs into him.Darunia and the goron forces, you’re with me, we’re going to head east. Ravio, you take Linkle and the hylian troops and head to the west. If any of you find him, send out some sort of signal, alright?. Go!” Impa ordered as she sent everyone into battle. “Why do I have to be supervised? I’d be totally cool and fine if I went out on my own!” Linkle complained “you’re staying with Ravio for your own safety, Volga is one of the most dangerous men in hyrule, it would be unwise to go alone, now get moving, there’s people out there who need help.” Impa said with the same strict attitude as before. And so, the two units charged into battle.

“This is dumb, I can definitely handle myself, I’m the legendary hero!” Linkle said to herself as she ran along the bridges of the forest. “Oh come on, it’s not that bad, I can’t be that unpleasant to be around?” Ravio said, running alongside her with his hammer. “I didn’t mean it like that, I’m just saying that Impa always treats me like a little girl, and not like the super tough and cool girl I am” Linkle said with a smirk. “Well maybe she just wants you to not die, not dying is pretty fun, and speaking of which...” Ravio said as their group encountered a group of monsters, Volga being in the direct center of them all. “Welcome, young challenger, today is the day we test your might and see if you are the one who can finally defeat me!” Volga shouted, fire spewing from his mouth “I think nows a good time to hit things, wouldn’t you agree?” Ravio said “yeah, probably” linkle responded, pulling out her crossbows. Soon the two armies began to clash, with monsters and soldiers being taken down left and right. Ravio seemed to be doing alright with his large arsenal of bombs and ice magic. However Linkle was not doing so good, as she wasn’t yet used to having to get her crossbows and arrows from her back instead of her boots. Even with this minor setback, Linkle was still able to put up quite the fight. “YAAAAHHH” Linkle screamed as she was hit in the legs with a boko club, this sudden impact to the legs had knocked both of her short boots off, leaving her feet bare, as socks had not yet been invented in hyrule. Even with every little twig and pebble poking into the skin of her feet, Linkle was able to take out many different monsters with her perfectly accurate and well timed crossbow shots. It didn’t take long before all the monsters were gone, and the only one still standing was Volga himself. “I see you have managed to dispatch of my men, no matter, now I can get a proper fight!” Volga said with a wild grin, eager to have a true challenge. “There’s five of us and only 1 of you!” Ravio said pointing to himself, Linkle and 3 captains “well, four of us if you have enough rupees, but I doubt you have any!” Ravio added, trying to profit as always. “I have no interest in fighting any of you but the girl! My vision told me of a girl with extraordinary power who was destined to defeat me! However I don’t see that happening, as I am a true warrior!” Volga shouted, more energized then he had ever been before “but first, a test, just to make sure I shouldn’t be going after the sheikah woman instead!” Volga said as he reared his head back, preparing to launch his fire breath “what do you mean tes-“ Linkle was cut off as flames enveloped her entire body “NO!” Ravio yelled in worry, but to his surprise, Linkle wasn’t harmed at all, even her clothes were fine, however something strange started to glow in her pocket, it was the stone she had picked up from before, as well as her grandmothers compass, both glowing as bright as the triforce itself. “What’s going on? Is this some sort of trickery?” Volga asked with a yell, when suddenly, the stone attached itself into the compass, and the spinner inside it began to spin wildly around and around.

A light had soon enveloped Linkle completely, leaving Ravio more worried then he had ever been, and Volga excited for what could possibly be making his opponent for powerful.
Soon, this light began to expand, and everyone could only watch in awe as Linkle’s body began to grow with it until she had finally grown to a grand height of 60 meters tall! (About 200 feet) Ravio and Volga, as well the other captains were simply speechless as they saw the little girl from before turn into a giant larger then anything they had seen before, even taller then hyrule castle itself. What did Linkle do first with her new size?
1151121.title: The beginning of Linkle’s big adventure

11511212.content:
The Dragon Knight himself let out a puff of smoke, his buff arms crossed. "So..." His smile grew. "It is her." He swept into a dark tree's shade with recovering allies - observing the living mountain's tactics.

When the blue crystal's magical light stopped blinding her, Linkle opened her eyes. At first, she twisted her head, braids cutting through the sky - she couldn't see anything but the tops of trees and clouds. But once she looked down...

"Woah..." She cupped her massive gloves to her mouth.

The lush green fields of the fair Faron Woods spread out before the curious little Cuckoo farmer's high-stretching form - her own traditional emerald tunic and brown pants joining the majestic trees' leaves. She stepped back, old oaks and elms quivering against her legs - fairies rushed out in surprise, fluttering by her pointed ears and outstretched eyelashes. Everything was there below: tiny captains and worn soldiers staring up at her; Impa and Darunia's forces in the East; monsters rushing for cover to the Dark Forest Keep, beneath gnarled growths that brushed by her knees and waist. Bursting with amazement, the "Legendary Hero" leaned in - the entire forest caught in the shimmer of her blue eyes as she breathed it in with excited gasps.

In days before the wars, Linkle's grandmother used to tell of an ancient warrior who descended from the skies upon a great bird. She wondered: is this what he saw? A sight reserved only for them... and balloon-mounted mapmakers. The smile across her face - able to swallow a man whole between her sweet lips - cast a bright, radiant eclipse over Impa's ragtag squadron and Volga's incursion alike, blocking out the scorching sun.

Their collective silence concluded when the girl jumped into the air, fist pumping up. "I'm... huge!" For a second, anyone looking up could see dirt embedded into her battle-weary soles. They braced themselves as she landed - a mighty quake shook the battlefield, knocking men nearby, rattling armor and shields for meters around.

The Hylian's giant jaw fell: that jump, alone, could stun them? She stood, in awe of the sheer power at her disposal... and not just a little cocky. A second wave of the monster army approached, having seized the nearby outpost. "Don't worry, everyone, I've got this one covered! Linkle, ho!" The Hylian shouldered an aged tree's side, sending it crashing with a resounding SNAP - and blocking the reinforcements' approach. With another troop approaching, she stomped the narrow path - Lizalfos slamming into the side of her sole. Their bites and swipes were harsh; but a simple kick sent them flying into the leaves around. She felt some of the keep's walls shatter on her skin; but what did it matter now? They had to make way for the hero!

Dirt clumps accumulated in her wrinkles and under her nails from the intense fight rained down indiscriminately on the captains - though to her, it was like twigs falling from her feet. The strong, earthy odors of the forest mixed in with the hours of hard work she'd put in the earlier fight, for a nostril-cleansing experience for the rushing soldiers. Ravio dashed left and right, clutching to his bunny hat - trying to pick up the products he'd dropped from her step, while dodging roots and branches uplifted by her stomps. The heroine's unwieldy, trembling legs carried a layer of perspiration from the long and warm travel. If only she'd agreed to buy some water from him, the heat from her toes wouldn't be so sweltering.

Impa said that they should stay together for safety against Volga; but was Volga really the biggest threat here?

Ravio stopped. In this chaos, within the feminine shadow, he noticed something jutting out. "Hey, watch out - below you!"

"HRAH!"

The crimson dragon rammed into Linkle, tackling her to the ground.

Hylian recruits screamed, diving for cover from the oncoming bottom - her own eyes wide in surprise. Her chestnut shorts fell into the soil, dragging dirt from the sheer force of her opponent's charge. A trail of allies dodges swiftly - pots of munitions shattered within the folds. Pain shot through her stomach. "Thanks, Ravio... Geez..." Her groans rattled the Faron Woods. She clutched for her opponent, cheeks red with tension and embarrassment. When her 19 meter long arms extended, the man returned to his human form, flipping back. Volga slipped between the tree-like digits, landing right by her sun-kissed thighs.

He barked: "Is this my promised challenge?" He twirled his spear, gazing at his opponent from behind the mask - and charged forward.

Urgh - was he underestimating her, too? She brought her thighs together, squeezing his armor with both great pillars. Earthy soil gathered up along them, tickling the sides. The sound of armor crushing against itself dominated the air. Even the immense strength built up in his biceps, of which he was justly proud, were naught before the muscles in her legs. In the middle of the crushing pain, the miniature army's leader laughed. "Ahah... Yes! This heat in my blood, it's so... fresh!" With both shoulders, he struck the skin away, using her sweat as lubricant on his sturdy armor to leap out.

Ravio, just wanting it to end, charged to intercept the knight - only for his flaming breath to dispel the merchant. "Coward, you are of no use to me!"

She jumped, recovering to her majestic height, ready to avenge her friend. Still not used to her weight, she waved her gloved hands for balance, causing miniature sonic booms. "Whup!" The Faron Woods' West Square bore a permanent imprint of her buttocks and shapely limbs in the ground. The simple action traced every intricate detail of her round rear below, and filled it with a puddle of her feminine fluids. The embarrassment made her pull her braids. Clutching her compass, she shouted: "Impa! Are you watching? I'll stop Volga, and save you all!"

In the Eastern Tree, the Sheikah was panting, surrounded by Lizalfos and Bokoblins. With a steady breath, and thoughts of the princess on her mind, the royal family's guardian shouted a war cry, and swung her Naginata. Enemies screeched, backing away - rushing to their master for aid before the blade touched them. Impa glanced at the towering ally between blows. At first, her mouth had fallen agape. Now, the girl served as a beacon. It appeared that Linkle's growth - her compass gleaming - had boosted the soldiers' morale. "Hah... 'Legend' or not, Hyrule has a great asset in her."

Knocking aside a Bokoblin, Darunia put a hand to his hip in pride. "She's even pulling off a Goron Pound! Haha, what a brother!"

"Goron Pound?" The commander winced at the sound of metal clashing. "...Oh, Hylia, please no!" She covered her ears.

With a mix of a song and a battle call, Linkle leaped again - remembering the strength it had last time. The wind from her spring blew blades of grass clean off. This time, she aimed right for the Dragon Knight! Her round heels, with murky sediments squeezed within the creases of her skin, practically gleamed with energy in the warm sun. Volga stood ready, his mask tilted upwards for the blow, spear ready, boots firmly in place. "Face me!"

Slam.

Her legs descended, outstretched toes greedily digging into the ground.

Something scrunched beneath her - and she twisted on it in satisfaction, feeling the call of her precursors pushing her on.

But then, the dust cleared.

A sting on her toe.

Volga had dodged the attack, and was fighting back already.

A soldier lay near her low arch, grunting, mere seconds from death beneath her.

She unglued her foot from its deep crater , her pulse quickening, and her eyes widening.

"No... Oh, no!" The Hylian's mouth spread out in the sky in disgust and horror, her call making Cuckoos rush from afar.

Ravio had pushed the soldier away, in a rare moment of courage. And now, his body lay sprawled, stuck to the sole of his ally, having joined with the dirt and ruins accumulated in her relentless rampage.

Linkle pulled him out, resting his little body into her leathery gloves. Her soft lips trembled. His thin, fragile limbs hung as loose as his scarf, his bunny hood drooping over his head. Her spirit sunk, the tree trunks twisting around her in a panic.

"Retreat!" Captains called their subordinates to move, lest they join the multitude of twigs and boulders between her toes, or get caught wading in the translucent pools of perspiration forming in the soil.

The soldiers were running from her. "No! I just wanted to..." She reached out, crashing into leaves. "...I just had to be the hero..." Her hand sunk, her breaths heavy.

Another swipe from Volga's arms, below, sent her crashing backwards. Her rear smashed into a sturdy tree, shattering it against the cheeks. "Hmph, what of that fool?" He transformed into a dragon , wings blazing in the air. "You and I are of the same kin - deadly warriors! It is only natural for the weak to perish to our blades!"

In terror, the giantess dodged the beast's rocketing dive. "No... No, I'm not a killer!" She ran. She ran as fast as she could, carrying the unconscious Ravio in her hands - praying to the spirits above that he was okay. The knight took chase behind - she hastened, plowing through trees, the crunch of leaves beneath her a disgusting sensation.

Ropes of the young woman's braids crashed above the branches. Her unfettered toes quaked as she stepped, sending tremors over the soft ground and uprooting tall grass. With every lift of her muddied heels from the soft soil, she brought men to their knees, their weapons dropping. Every stomp brought tiny sprays of her sweat trickling down over their heads, and left a great footprint in place. She dodged them, her breaths stinging her, navigating the forest's curves - without her trusty map.

Someone in the Faron Woods could help him - she knew. With deep breaths, Linkle ran towards...
11511212.title: Giantess Linkle's First Steps

choices: See if Impa or Darunia can help
115112121.content:
Thud thud THUDTHUD

With the swiftness of an arrow, Linkle's heels bounced over the trees. Her bare toes plowed loose branches and shrubs, or else trampled them beneath. Like twigs, they broke off and joined her muddy soles.

She clutched her fallen ally in her glove, close to her rattling compass. The Great Deku Tree was in the massive Hylian's sight. Impa's forces had a barricade set up there. Ravio would be safe there, under the Forest Guardian's protection. The fluttering leaves and age-old bark glowed in her blue eyes - distorted by small tears.

This wasn't supposed to happen. It wasn't fair. He'd rushed his life to push a soldier away from under her foot (HER own foot - the blonde shuddered). And what did he have to show for it?

"I can fix this..." She gulped down her doubts. This couldn't be real. Any time, she told herself, Ravio would wake up, ready to cheer her on. But each time she looked at the salesman, he was limp as always - color draining from him. Her teeth chattered in the fresh air.

From behind, Volga rushed in hot pursuit. His blazing spear sliced the uprooted and fallen trunks in her wake. "Fool. To deny the combat's heat in your veins..." He shouldered an oak flying at him, smashing it to splinters. "This 'Legendary Hero' spits in the face of destiny!"

Head shaking, Linkle didn't even look over her shoulder. "Is fighting all that matters to you?"

In fury, he blasted out flame balls. The projectile hit her immense backside, still holding debris from the old fort.

"Hyah!" Pain jolting through her expanded nerves, the gigantic Hylian stumbled. Thankfully, gentle leaves broke her fall; otherwise, a whole fort might have disappeared under her. The passenger in purple was still safely in hand - but growing paler by the second.

She pulled out her crossbow with a free hand, firing arrows at the red-armored man - which he swiftly dodged. Frustrated, she slammed the weapon into the ground. With a splat, its brown surface stuck deep in the dirt, blending in with the roots and growths surrounding. The structure formed enough of a roadblock to stop him. With the post off her tail, she continued to the heart of the Faron Woods.

"I'll come back for those later." She nodded. It didn't matter what weapons she had. As long as her grandmother's compass hung on her neck, and the traditional green tunic blessed her immense frame, she was still The Hero - and The Hero had to save people.

The Dragon Knight took heavy breaths, kicking the side of the structure in frustration. It'd take at least four grown men to operate that crossbow, let alone move it. Calling a Bokoblin scout, he sent a signal: "Block off the sapling. Don't let that coward escape me." From every bush and grove, across the natural canopies, his soldiers slipped in. Arms crossed, he stared at the sky, and the blonde hair overtaking it. "Gods, you promised me blood."

The growths tangled and twisted around them. Old bark and stone structures, glorious and vast to any normal Hylian, cramped the immense archer. She could barely turn here without her elbows colliding with elderly oaks and birches; protective walls collapsing against her bare ankles; or scores of ragtag combatants falling in her footprints. Try as she might to weave between the tight spaces - keeping her head down to avoid bumping it - the humongous Hylian's frame tore the natural landscape of the western woods' reaches. Debris on her soles fell, leaving more roadblocks in her wake.

Larger timbers blocked the path ahead. Turning on her heel, she slipped, before leaping up straight again. "Can't go by here, so..." She pointed to the north. "I'll take another route!"

---

The last Lizalfos, panting, collapsed from a blow of Darunia's mighty hammer. He pumped his hammer in the sky. "Hah! Try again after some Death Mountain training!" Finally, the Eastern Tree was secure.

Impa, tending to her minor wounds, wiped her brow. "No sign of Volga... We can guess he's met up with our 'brothers'. I can only hope he hasn't bought Ravio off." She gazed at the moving mountain, shaking her head. "Where is that girl running? Is there something at the Dark Forest Keep?"

In the middle of their discussion, a messenger rushed to her, so hurried that he stumbled on roots. "Ma'am, swarms of monsters suddenly started attacking the Great Deku Tree! We're getting overwhelmed here!"

The Sheikah finished applying her bandage, and grabbed her Naginata. "We'll converge there. Let the other forces know."

Calling his forces to roll out, the Goron chief crossed his arms. "You think our 'hero' can handle it?"

Impa brushed her bangs aside, and smiled. "I believe we can handle it."

---

"Come on, this isn't funny!" In the winding woods, Linkle glanced left and right, keeping her shoulders tucked closely to her torso. What was once a straight path grew more and more twisted with each stomp. Even when she took "shortcuts", kicking and punching dead wood to thousands of splinters, she didn't recognize anything about the tiny surroundings.

"It's gotta be this way! Please..." She held tight to the compass, staring at its needle - and making sure Ravio was secure.

The growing humidity, combined with her own body heat and sweat washing over the area, made the ground muddy and swamp-like. Her soles dug deeper in the ground with each step, scattering insects from their groves. She found herself moving to a slog.

From the shadows, a loose Aeralfos swooped forward. The Hylian was too firmly rooted to dodge in time. From a series of intense blows, Linkle fell down, crashing through rows of branches and walls.

Crack-crack-crack-THUNK.

Her torso crushed 40 square meters of land, encompassing the entire Dark Forest Keep. An immense tremor shook the woods, blowing foliage, and stunning scores of soldiers from both factions.

When she rose, avalanches of dirt fell from her body. A large portion of the enemy army had perished beneath the blonde's bosom. "I don't have time for this, guys!" With her face red and scratched, the green giantess spotted - and swiftly kicked out. The side of her foot squashed him into wood; when she pulled it back, the trunk bent, and toppled. It hit and crushed several more pieces of foliage, revealing a clear path for the Great Deku Tree.

She hummed a short "you found a secret" jingle, and dusted herself clean with a free arm. But when she brushed her chest, cleaning it of debris and monsters' weapons, something was missing.

"Grandma's compass! Not again!" Linkle slapped herself. That treasure was proof of her status as Legendary Hero. Every one of her astounding victories, she'd won thanks to its magic... Panicking, she overturned massive boulders, shook branches clean of leaves, and dug up the ground. "I must've dropped it in the ground! Or did it snag on a branch? Or..."

With her breath short, she sunk her head, closing her eyelids. With a deep breath, she placed a hand on Ravio's loose hat. "Later." Hood tucked on her, the Hylian left the keep, making her way for the target.
