The road forward was straight. With a skip, hop, and a stomp, she could hit the wooden Forest Guardian in moments. But there was a big problem for the big cucco farmer: when she stepped just north of her destination, scores of Hylians and Lizalfos were during at her bare feet.

Looking for an empty spot, she tried to step into it. But no matter where her boot landed, many allies would fall under it. Cupping a hand, she screamed down: "Hey! Hero coming through! I have to save someone!" Some of the combatants fled; but many were too wounded to move, and simply accepted their fate. The titaness leaned closer, scooping them in her gloves - but she couldn't hold them all. And, she wondered, could air travel do something bad with their wounds?

Peering down to a captain, the girl's huge braids swayed, bending old branches. "I can't get in without squishing someone! Please carry Ravio and the others to the Deku Tree!" She lowered her leather gloves, showing the wounded warriors to him.

He backed away, knowing the fearsome carnage this titan wrought upon the West Square's monster incursion. "The raid captains won't let us breathe! If we abandon our posts, there'll be nowhere for them to rest at all!" He pointed to the approaching waves of green lizard-people.

"Urgh..." She shifted her warm feet, shaking the surrounding soldiers with it. If she fought here, she could hurt someone - or defile the forest's magical growth.

Raiders approaching, clanging their swords against steel shields. Desperate allies in her unsteady hands. Soldiers below, people she knew from the village, who could get hurt just as easily.

No time to grumble. Linkle made her decision:
115112121.title: Dash to the Deku Tree

choices: "Grow me into the biggest hero ever!"
1151121211.content:
"Hey, no problem! I'll fight them off! As long as I'm wearing the tunic, I'm still the hero! And a hero's destiny is to save people!" Linkle clenched a fist in resolve - before feeling a dry crunch.

Remembering the people held in it, the Hylian quickly uncurled her giant, shaking fingers. Everyone looked in stable condition, if startled. Except Ravio; he didn't move beyond an occasional breath. It was as if he were asking, "what about saving me?"

Lowering herself to a knee, the blonde loosened her grasp, letting them slide off near the guard. "Please, get these guys in, I'll handle the rest!"

Her teammates carried them to safety, under the Great Deku Tree's watch. The minuscule soldiers' silence was a cacophony to her pointed ears. Their tired stares burned into her head. That flame only grew as Bokoblins, Lizalfos, and Poes approached, seeking to seize the safe zone.

She'd been given the perfect opportunity to make up for her accident. To save them. And to prove herself, too. If she kept her distance, she'd be doing her part.

"...Right!"

Linkle dashed towards the onslaught. Her immense soles pounded like war drums. The monsters shook from the immense quakes, paralyzed. She stopped, breaking on her heel; mudslides covered the first wave of troops. The dirty heel's flesh collided with the rest of them, dragged across the ground, their armor twisting. She charged a stomp, lifting her knee in the air - but remembered what happened last time. The feeling of living things scrunching under her skin gave her goosebumps. The foes took advantage her pause to hack away at her ankles, scratching the soft surface. Hylians and Gorons watching called to her: "Come on!"

With a decisive nod, she swung her foot, and simply kicked the monsters. The heaviest of them went flying; lighter ones rocketed to the stratosphere. Shrill echoes of the enemies' voices faded into the distance, as they fell into tree leaves, incapacitated.

A battle cry pulled the titan's attention behind her. Soldiers remaining on the field were clashing swords with Lizalfos, numbers slowly dwindling. Turning on the ball of her foot, the archer leaned down, and uprooted huge chunks of land out from underneath the combatants. Soil sifted through her gloved fingers as she lifted them up. Each of them shook, unsure of her tactic. She plucked up her allies by their helmets, resting them in her compass-less chest. They tickled slightly; she struggled to stay still. As for the enemies, she lifted her hand to her face, her huge pink lips looming above them. They puckered into a narrow aperture, before she blew them off. Like leaves scattered to the wind, the monsters fluttered into the distance.

"Hah, that's more baddies taken care of..." The green-hooded girl pumped a fist, and lowered herself to the ground. The combattants descended from the soft platform, giving various cries.

"Such strength!"

"Scary..."

"She's not crushing any of them?"

Linkle itched at her locks. "Guess I knocked you guys out of position..."

A scout called. Some marched to the west - their protector followed. Another crowd of beasts approached, having found their way around her footprints. The colossus simply glared at them, standing to her full 60 meter height, and stomped on the ground. They examined the behemoth: from rope-like golden braids; to her flowing emerald tunic; to her bare legs and feet, marble pillars in their own right. Instantly, the beasts fled, taking cover.

She wiped her hands in satisfaction. "Looks like that's the last of them!" But as soon as she said that, something rang by her ears. She turned. A crimson figure tore through the treetops with outstretched wings, hurdling for her.

---

Impa and Darunia's troop made it in, helping their wounded return to the safe camp, and picking off stragglers. The immense warrior provided a new shade for their tired bodies, along with the existing, rustling shadows of high-reaching leaves.

When they entered, the sight of healing men and women made the Goron sob. "Brothers... You've fought well!" He beat his chest in honor, brushing a rocky hand near them. "I love a good, burly brawl as much as anyone - but Volga's gone too far!"

Shouldering through men, trying to get a closer view of the situation, the Sheikah heard an odd murmur. Ravio rested, stiller than he'd ever been, with a soldier at his side. As she tilted her neck in question, the slightly bruised trooper explained: "Th-that girl in green! He... She was going to crush me, but he pushed me away..." Upon further examination, the merchant's scarf had irregular tears, in circles; as if something had pressed and twisted against his body.

She gave a lengthy look at the two, before marching North, wordlessly scowling. That gigantic young woman was there, fighting even now. To think, she'd raised the troops' morale minutes ago... Now, her allies cringed with every pound of her sole. The commander had to stop her somehow - or learn more.

Those thundering steps were unsteady. The towering knees and shins tumbled around the Great Deku Tree, knocking over oaks and elms. She peered up, and a flash of burning embers made her wizened eyes wide.

Volga.

---

"Volga!" Linkle's shout cascaded throughout the branches, rousing flocks of owls and Keese.

One of her titanic arms swung out to grasp him. The Dragon Knight arced his flight underneath it, and blew a ball of flame.

The towering Hylian extinguished it with a wave of her arm. "This isn't the time! Stop it!" She slapped him out of the sky with a wave of her palm.

Landing in a tree, the warrior panted, reverting to his human form. "Rrhh... First, my forces attack you, despite my directions... Now, you continue to deny my destiny." He snarled in fury, leaping for her face.

She didn't dodge in time; the man had grabbed her right braid, and slashed her cheek. "Ow! Just quit it! I won't hurt anyone else!" She shook her head, swinging it around left to right - the gusts blowing her opponent off.

"You can't escape it." He performed a three-point landing on a branch, puffing embers from the sides of his thin lips. "The prophecy said a woman would appear with the power to defeat me - so show your strength!"

The battle-thirsty man lunged forward.

The farmer stood strong.

Clang.

His blade hit another.

Volga's bone helmet lifted. "Hrrmph." He swept his spear to his side.

Impa had parried his blow with her naginata.

Linkle stamped her feet, caught between embarrassment and relief. "Impa! I-I-"

"I saw Ravio." The older fighter didn't look up. "Don't move."

The girl gulped. Was the commander angry? It was only right, after all the damage she caused. But then again - what about everything she'd done to help the Deku Tree?

With an open stance, the enemies' leader started to laugh. "Hah, a duel? At last, someone with honor." Spear twirling, he lunged ahead. "I've found my foe!"

They clashed near the colossal foot, trading blows. Amid swift strikes, the dragon warrior scaled the towering toes for a height advantage. The farmer tried to wiggle him off - but his footing was steady. In response, the princess' guardian leaped from trees, landing on the archer's belt. The titan struggled to stand in place - wanting to offer support, but knowing how much of a danger every twitch was.

Crimson wings swept around her armpits. Impa's boots scaled her chest. They swung at each other across her elongated limbs; they dueled atop the golden fields of her braids; and they even fell into her shirt. She groaned at the sensation of their bodies on her skin, facing downwards. A little tug - Volga was grasping to her soft, bulbous breast for support. "I'm - I'm a hero, not a battlefield!" She nearly swatted the itchy spots on her skin, but held back.

Finally, the grey-haired woman made an exit through her collar. "He's vicious... No matter what size." She stood vigil, watching for her opponent's next move.

From the side, the red-clad knight blew a great breath of fire. It spurted out with searing intensity

"Hah!" The princess' servant dodged.

"Woah!" Linkle swept her arm in shock.

The flames caught on a tree's leaves.

And then another.

Then on a large, dry branch.

Within a blink, the Hylians' safe haven became an inferno. Burning odors tainted the fresh air. No matter where she looked, there was searing fire.

She attempted to blow it out, or spit on it; but the wind and water only intensified the all-consuming embers. She stomped out trees, snuffing the blaze under her bare feet - cringing at the heat. The dead wood continued to burn, feeding the devastating forest fire.

"Left! Soldiers, to the river!" Impa shouted commands, rushing for barrels of water.

Darunia hurled rocks onto it.

Volga took flight - but a falling branch fell on him. It weighed him to the ground, trapping him at the Cucco farmer's feet. "This... isn't the end!"

Ravio choked, his breaths growing unsteady.

The cuckoo farmer shut her eyes, not daring to move. "It's breaking apart... But... I tried so hard! I tried... to help..."

A voice echoed in her mind: "Do you want to be the hero?"

She stood motionless. "...Who are you? The Great Fairy?"

It laughed gently. "That gem you found is quite special. If you so wish, I could grow you taller. Nobody would doubt you. You'd stop this fire with a whisper. You'd be Hyrule's greatest protector... And it costs you nothing."

She shivered. Was that what she needed - more power? Clutching to her green tunic, Linkle thought of her friends...

And decided:
1151121211.title: The Heat of the Battle

11511212112.content:
"This height is fine!" Linkle declared to the voice in her head, not caring who heard her call. "I'm fighting for everyone here! No matter how cool it'd be, I'd hurt someone if I grew any bigger!"

The mysterious entity cooed: "They don't believe in you..."

The Hylian smiled to herself. "I don't need to prove anything. That's what started this trouble."

It became a whisper: "You'd be a hero..."

"I am a hero..." She pumped both fists to her sides. Her legs stood firm among burning treetops. In the distance, nearly lost among the murky trees, her dropped compass glowed in radiant gold. "...No... I'm THE hero!"

Her spirit focused. Both blue eyes snapped open, glowing with a rekindled light in the scorched sky. Amid the smoke clouds, the thinnest traces of doubt left her mind.

Gorons and Hylians rushed to control the flames; blocking their path and cutting off air with boulders; extinguishing them with buckets of water; and moving the wounded to safer places. Darunia bellowed: "If I'd known this would happen, I'd have called Princess Ruto for water power!"

Impa shuddered. "We can summon the Fountain Fairy, but the inferno will have spread too far by then." She clenched her teeth. "We can't save everything, but perhaps part of the woods..."

Volga struggled from his wooden prison, trapped under the destroyed trees. "The fates robbed me of a fair fight... Now, they rob me of a warrior's death..." His mighty strength couldn't hope to lift the wood, even in draconic form.

Everyone was trying their hardest. She wouldn't give up.

Hesitating briefly, Linkle slid out from the sleeves. She removed her green cloak - the cloak matching those previous heroes of legend wore. It lay in her hands, worn from battle, but with the seams holding strong. The only remaining sign of her status. The final proof of her destiny. The gift of her grandmother. She quietly caressed it, running the top of her glove across its side. "I'm sorry, grandma... I'll miss it."

With a twist, the Hylian flapped her tunic in the air, casting a shadow over the Faron Woods. She waved it; the flares weakened at the mighty winds. But not enough; soon, everything lit in red again. Holding it flat, she lowered the cloth on the flaming treetops.

Fizzle...

From underneath, Impa gasped. It was like a humongous blanket covered the sky. Drops of sweat and dirt descended upon the soldiers. Branches, even the sturdy wood of the Great Deku Tree, wept under the weight. Blazes caught in the emerald fibers, tearing holes in it...

...Until they finally died. Smoke lifted from the trees. The heat was no more. The warrior used her clothes to snuff out the fire, depriving it of oxygen.

"Hah..." Panting from her huge lungs drifted among the branches, on a cool breeze. She fell on her rear, her house-sized face flushed. When she lifted her gear, it had gaping burns. She tried to put it on, but it felt charred enough to disintegrate in her hands.

That didn't matter. The flames were gone. Thanks to the others' efforts, they'd been contained; and she smothered the last of them. The people below left their spots, panic quieting. All except for one...

Volga snarled, struggling to escape from the wooden weight. He called up, unable to move: "Girl! I'm at your mercy. Fulfill your destiny! End this battle with your greatest strike!"

With a twinkle in her eye, the tremendous warrior lifted her fist in the air. Her white shirt stretched to accommodate the outstretched arm. Darunia covered his face, cringing. "He's - really serious, isn't he?"

In a single swoop, Linkle punched down.

Boom.

The tree cracked, breaking the Dragon Knight free. He tapped at his chest, standing up, with an arm outstretched in shock.

She put a hand to her hip, scowling. "That won't solve anything. Get out, and don't push around people like that anymore!"

"A woman with the strength to best me..." With a dry chuckle, Volga bowed his head. "I'll have to contemplate what the gods meant." And with what was left of his dignity, he shifted to his dragon form, flying in retreat with the other dark forces.

The titan didn't take her eyes off him until he was a speck in the distance. Then, she slumped her shoulders, breathing a long, cathartic sigh. Her neck sunk, view lowering to the forest. Cuccos chirped in the stillness. "It's over... Did I... make the right choice?"

With her naginata sheathed, Impa walked to her, smiling up. "I told you to stay in place. Good thing you're a terrible listener." She pointed to the soldiers picking themselves up, reuniting with friends and returning to the village. "You have a lot to contemplate, too. But we all need to rest from this. Even heroes."

Darunia rolled in. "Rest? Ha! I'm throwing a real Goron celebration for our brothers here!" He pounded his mallet in the ground. "This was a brawl for the ages!"

Linkle's lips shifted. "Ravio... Is he okay, after I..." She took a breath. "...After I stepped on him?"

The two exchanged glances, expressions darkening. Her heart weighed heavy. Above the trees, with little troops surrounding her, the blonde Hylian felt very, very small.

...Until mauve glimmer crossed her eye. The merchant's bunny hood wobbled, as he approached his fellow captains from behind - and grabbed their shoulders. "Hey! Glad I could sit this fight out." He rubbed his neck. "It smarts, but those healers sure know how to glue a guy together. It's like a fairy was helping them!"

A voice in the recess of her mind laughed lightly.

Impa nodded. "Thank the heavens!"

Darunia crushed him in a hug. "Brother!"

She lay on the treetops in relief, letting the leaves caress her immense arms.

"A real hero's reward..."

---

~A week later~

"Hyah!"

Linkle pushed a post in place, enclosing the Cuccos near her farm. She rubbed her hands together. "Ha, that's another item off the to-do list!... Hey!"

A chick scurried through a hole too small for the gigantic farmer to perceive. She groaned, trying to grab the bird - and missing twice, digging out huge hand prints from her crops. "This size has a few downsides..."

As she followed it, she spotted Ravio approaching. He bowed and grabbed her escaped Cucco, throwing it in the enclosure again. "Hey, Linkle! Still stuck at this height?"

She shrugged, grinning. "Until I can find something to reverse that gem, yeah."

The boy in the bunny costume raised a finger. "Well, then, guess this'll come in handy!"

"Oh!" In awe, the gigantic blonde or her hands to her mouth.

From behind him, a few villagers carried massive monoliths. Two boots, almost an exact match for her old ones; only big enough for her. And behind them, more carried a new tunic, only in a light blue hue.

Practically jumping with excitement, the young woman grabbed it, and immediately slid it on. "Thank you! Thank you!"

Ravio rubbed the rear of his hood. "Couldn't get enough green fabric where I live. I know that's the hero's color."

It was a perfect fit. With a smile, she answered: "Maybe it'll set a new trend! Legendary Heroes in the future might start wearing blue, in honor of this!" She stretched her hands out, ecstatic at the new costume.

The salesman laughed. "Glad to hear! As a gift... I'll give it to you for 100 Rupees off!"

Linkle blinked. "What?"

"Hah, got you!"

Their laughter echoed across the village. With her compass, crossbows, and now her clothes back, everything was closer to normal. And though she needed time to adjust, she had her friends and her grandma to help.

Her compass dangled above the poultry's white and brown feathers, around her neck - glowing softly.
11511212112.title: End of the Girl in the Green Tunic

1152.content: So, which of the 3 games are you going to choose?
1152.title: Oracle Games and Link's Adventure

11521.content: So, which girl from Ages are you going to pick?
11521.title: Oracle of Ages

choices: The Orcarina of Time/ Majora's Mask
1153.content: I think I'll alter the format slightly so it's easier to get choices these. Instead choose a Zelda game then choose the character you wish to enlarge.
1153.title: Game Choices

choices: Nabooru from the Ocarina of Time.
11531.content: The two most epic Zelda titles to ever grace the N64 console. Alright Choose a girl.
11531.title: The Orcarina of Time/ Majora's Mask

choices: She initiates a plan with her Gerudos
115311.content:
In the Gerudo Valley, Nabooru was walking through the fortress bored out of her mind. Since Link saved the world, there's been nothing for her to do anymore.

When she walked over to the entrance to the Great Desert, she found a tall object right in front of her. What is this?. She proceeds to pick it up and it looks like a medallion.

After a few short moments nothing happened to Nabooru and she proceeded to walk back, but as Nabooru started walking, her body gained three feet in height.

When she reached the fortress, Nabooru was stunned to see her body had grown. "What on earth happened to me?"

As she looked around, she pulled out the medallion and began to put it together. "This medallion must have caused it."

But this gave her an idea. The Gerudo were living in horrible conditions, mocked by the rest of the world. But now Nabooru has a chance to prove to Hyrule that the Gerudo's deserve their respect.
115311.title: Nabooru from the Ocarina of Time.

choices: Have the other Gerudo treat her like a goddess
1153111.content:
Before she can do anything, she feels another growth burst coming, and before she knows it, she already towered over the buildings. Luckily, her clothes grew alongside her.
The other Gerudo started to notice her giant leader and started rushing over to her.
Nabooru, now even taller than their highest building, can't help but giggle at her fellow Gerudo, now like tiny bugs next to her. She could barely hear their tiny voices, asking what happened.
It was a weird sense of power she felt and a thought crossed her mind...
1153111.title: She grows even more.

choices: Drop her in her shoe and keep her as an insole
11531111.content:
She giggles at the tiny women, now all looking up at her in fear. She sits down on a building behind her (while also sitting down on a guard that was standing there, now being trapped under Naboorus rear end without her even noticing) and speaks down to her new tiny servants:
"I am now your goddess!" Her booming voice cause them to shake in fear. "Worship me or I'll end your pathetic lives!"
The Gerudo all quickly kneeled down and started worshiping Nabooru, scared for their lives.
All except for one...
One of the guards threw down spear and started running off. But not fast enough.
Nabooru simply grabbed the little woman mid run and holds her up to her face.
She laughs "Hahaha, alright then, guess I'll show what happens to those that oppose me!"
The little woman begs for her life, but its too late. Nabooru has already planned a perfect punishment....
11531111.title: Have the other Gerudo treat her like a goddess

choices: Lay down on the Hyrule-Field and have people come to her
11531112.content:
Before she can do anything, once more, she grows even larger. All the tiny Gerudo started running and scream. Nabooru got tall enough to step over the mountain wall that separated Gerudo-Valley from the desert and she had to do it, due to her feet getting too large for the small village beneath her.
She kept growing and growing, until it finally stopped. The medallion that caused all this, slowly broke apart and fell into dust.
Nabooru looked down. Her foot now was big enough to step on all of Gerudo-Village at once!
She looks around, seeing the large land of Hyrule, but now far smaller. She giggles.
She was now literally a goddess, even taller than Death Mountain!
She decides to go show the people of Hyrule just what kind of woman she is...
11531112.title: Grow even more!

1153112.content:
She decided to go through with her plan and started to organize herself with the others.
Their plan was, to grow a bunch of their best warriors and set off to both Hyrule-Castle and Zoras Domain, as they were the largest two places that would be worth attacking.
After a whole night of planing, 15 Gerudos, all standing 100 feet tall and Nabooru, now being 200 feet tall, stood outside Gerudo-Valley, ready to show the rest of Hyrule some respect.
Now, they only had to choose their first target...
1153112.title: She initiates a plan with her Gerudos

1153121.content:
It was a bright and sunny spring's day in Hyrule. The sky was partially cloudy with bright blue skies. The river that ran through Zora's domain was a beautiful clear blue. The lush grass which flourished throughout Hyrule fields blew peacefully in the calm winds. And birds perched in the large oak trees scatter throughout the land sang their joyful hims. It was the perfect day.

Much time had passed since the evil Gerudo's King of Demon's, Ganondorf had been sealed away. An entire year to be exact. Link now lives in Hyrule Castle with the Hylian royal family, guarding their many precious treasures and assisting the Princess, Zelda Hylia, in any way in his power as the Hero of Time.

The sages have rejoined the world of the living, resuming their regular duties of their normal lives. Saria has been named most wise of the Forest of the Kokiri. Darunia is now regarded as the greatest Goron to have ever lived. Rauru remained in the Chamber of the Sages, safeguarding it from any impending dark forces and awaiting the day the world would need them again. Ruto returned to her life as the Princess, soon to be the Queen, of the Zoras. Impa has returned to Hyrule Castle, but tries to keep her reputation as a sage shrouded in shadows, much like her personality. And Nabooru disappeared from the eyes of the world, but secretly holds the reputation as the Queen of Theives.

But our lies elsewhere. It began as a Forest Fairy's vow to help lead The Hero's way to victory over the Tyrant King. It has now become that fairy's wish to forever be with this hero. And, like before, deep in the Kokirian Forest is where it shall begin.


+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

The village of the Kokiri was well active.

Mido and his group creating a new bridge for the Northeast and Northwest Watchmen's towers, as the last bridge was broken by a large, fallen tree limb. Julie and her two twin sister's, Rurie and Yurie, all minded the shops and such while the other working Kokiri fixed the bridge. Other Kokiri simply followed through with their usual day-to-day activities. And Saria, care free as can be, sat on the roof of the tallest of the tree houses in the Villages, supervising the work being done.

Saria was, to tell you the truth, lost as to what to do today. She had grown so used to the sage's life that returning to her own was a bit of a step taken too fast. The repairs on the bridge lasted until night fall. Saria slouched with a grumpy and pouting look on her face. "Foo. Did it really have to take away the entire day?" She complained. She might have been wise, but she was also just a kid. And no amount of time could change that part about her. Or for that matter, any of the Kokiri.

That's when her green glow forest fairy, Sinibi flew by her ear and asked, "Saria, can't find Navi. She disappeared." Saria raised a brow as she looked at Sinibi, then asked, as her response, "Again?" She then took a moment and bowed her head as she sighed. "Alright. I'll go find her." Saria told her, getting up and walking to the roof's ladder.

That left little Sinibi all by herself. That's when a dark-neon glow Forest Fairy flew over to her and said, "Heeey, Sinibi! You wanna cool place to cuddle up together an-" Sinibi punched him in mid-sentence, as this fairy was jerk who always wanted to flirt with her. Needless to say, she had enough of him.

"Buzz off, Hex!" She shouted.

He started to fly away, but nervously stopped, turned around and asked, "Does that me-"

"Away, Hex!!!" She shouted at the top of her lungs, making him fly off at lightning speed.


Elsewhere, in Link's old tree house, Navi lay on the pillow of Link's bed. Compared to the pillow, she was practically minuscule. She let her light become very dim, making her true body visible. She had the body of a human Teenage girl who had begun to take on a womanly shape, which is what you could expect, as at the age she was, she could be considered a 14 year old by the other Fairies. She had large, pointed, elfish ears. Her skin was a very light blue that was nearingly white. Her medium size, cute eyes had a darker shade of blue to them. And she wore a type of white dress which was fairly resemblant to that of a house coat with no sleeves or collar, covering as far up as her petite chest and reaching as far down as her shins. The rest of her was bare. In the back of the dress were four slits for her large wings, which were fairly full body length, if not slightly larger than her.

She wore a sad expression on her face, coupled with a deep pink blush that ran across her face. She was missing the boy she had made such great friends with... nay. Had fallen in love with... Link.

After their journey was over, they parted ways. Link told her that it was just far too dangerous to accompany him any longer. She knew he was only looking for her and trying to protect her, but the fact that she probably would never see him again, because he was most likely destined for the princess. She had bared this unsure fact on her shoulders through the entire year's ordeal. Even if Link would love her back, the laws of the world were very clear. A fairy could not marry with a human. Not even a Great Fairy was allowed this privilege...

She then heard someone climbing up the ladder, drawing her back into reality and forcing these thought to submerge to the back of her mind. She then let her glow grow bright again, hiding her body behind it. Then she began to rapidly flap her wings until she was floating in the air right as the drape at the entrance of the tree house was slid open, revealing Saria.

"Oh! Hello, Saria!" Navi said in her normal high and cheery sounding voice. Saria looked at her suspiciously, wondering what she was doing in here...for the second time.

Saria then walked to the bed and sat down on the mattress. Then she looked at Navi with a compassionate and caring look on her face. "I'm not a fool, Navi. I can see something's wrong. And something tells me that this something's name might be Link." Navi immediately jumped at Link's name and pulled her arm behind her back gripping one with the other, nervously looking away from Saria. "Navi, You know the laws of this world more than anyone. It is simply impossible for two of a different Kind to truly be together...Including the Sages." Saria admitted, looking at her feet and closing her eyes. Navi Felt a shutter of hot discomfort, remembering that Saria too loved Link, but far before she did.

Navi felt a sickening jolt of sadness flutter up in her stomach. She bit down as hard as she possibly could, trying to contain her feeling. She even shut her eyes so tight it hurt...but eventually her feeling came out in tears that rolled down her cheeks. She sniffled, contained her wine as best she could. Her Glow then began to dim. That's when Saria opened her eyes in confusion, as the lighting in the room had just gotten dimmer.

She looked at Navi and for the first time, she saw what Navi really looked like. She could see her discomfort written clear across the fairy's tiny face.

Navi's emotions finally overcame her and she muttered, "It not fair.....it's not..." Saria felt even more confused. Navi descended slowly back onto the pillow. She then let herself fall into sitting position.

Saria scooted in closer to Navi. She then put her head down on the pillow, making certain she wouldn't be touching Navi. "We should get some rest. It's gotten pretty late, now. We might as well sleep here for the night, as well."

Navi layed down onto her side of the pillow and got onto her side so she was facing Saria. Saria had already closed her eyes and was nearly half asleep. Navi then whispered, "Hey... It's not like Link would mind." And closed her eyes to rest.

Saria just barely heard her. "Oh, Navi..."


=======================================================

Choice one: In the morning, Navi is visited by the Great Forest Fairy, Lilium. She tells Navi that she knows of a way that Navi can be with Link. She gives her the ability to change her size and appearance at will. (I will be writing this one.)

Choice two: Make up your own method in which you want Navi to grow.
1153121.title: A Fairy's Love.

11531211.content:
It was the middle of the night. Saria was fast asleep, but Navi couldn't sleep a wink.

She was still thinking about Link, the boy who her heart ached for. It was enough that the two of them couldn't be together, but the year she spent separated from him was the longest of her entire life. It made her stomach turn when she thought about why they would never be together. All because of the worldly order.

Her stomach started to flutter with emotions again and tear droplets formed in the corners of her eyes. She buried her face into the giant pillow, hoping that she could block her tears with it's cushion. They did not come, but she kept her face buried in fear that they might start to form again.

That's when a heavenly green glow flooded into the room. Navi looked up from the pillow see that the glow was coming from outside. She rapidly fluttered her wings and began to fly toward the entrance of the tree house. When she got outside, she saw a bright green glow form into a ball of light and from the back of the glow, four fairy wings sprouted.

Navi leaned in closer to the ball of light with wing and thought aloud. "Sinibi?" But she didn't get a response. Instead, the ball of light flew away from her and into the forest. Navi, taken by surprise, called out, "Hey, wait!" And flew after it into the dense forests. The ball of light swiftly dodged through the trees and their branches, seemingly trying to get away from her, but Navi, determined to figure out who it was, kept up with it. They eventually came to a large clearing in the forest where a spring with many large rocks with strange marking written on them.

The ball of light flew to the center of the spring and descended down toward it's and dissolved like ice into, forming a large circle of green light in the center of the spring. Out of this light rose a humanly form that glowed, just as the light did. When it stood above the circle, it's full form was that of a matured woman's at about 7'10" feet tall. Long and flowing green hair formed and reached down as far as near shin, much like Navi's, except her's was dark blue. A gust of wind flowed around the figure's body, making a heavenly robe form around it, the sides of the robe hung loose on the figures shoulders as it's hands moved to it heart's area, pressing against it with both hands. Leaves that had fallen from the tree and fell into the spring gathered around the back and sides of her forehead like a crown. Elvish ears forms under the crown. The face of the figure, one in which was like a goddess's formed. It's beautiful eyes opened and reveal their grass green color. Four large fairy wings that seemed to be made of the moonlight that shun down through a large opening in the trees formed on her back. The green glow of the figured dimmed to reveal a beautiful goddess standing in the middle of the spring.

Navi instantly recognized this woman as she was the one who first assigned her to the great deku tree back when the world was still being threatened by the presence of Ganondorf. "Great Fairy, Lilium!", she whispered to herself.

Lilium gazed upon Navi. She too recognized the fairy she had given up for the sake of the world. She smiled lovingly. "Navi." She said in an a calmed, goddessly voice.

Navi flew at a great speed toward Lilium, who now held out her hands in front of her. The blue fairy clung to her upper chest in a hug with glee as the great fairy put both hands over her, gently returning her hug. Navi cuddle up to Lilium's chest as best she could. Then they separated and Navi spoke, "I've missed you!"

"As have I you, young one." Lilium told her likewise. "The forest wasn't the same with your absence. It was far too quiet without the blue fairy whom I missed ever so. But this fact, dear child, is not the one I've brought you here for."

Navi gasped silently, caught off guard by her statement. Navi knew exactly what she meant. She just couldn't believe she'd known.

"I have known for quite the while. Your Love for the Hero of Time runs deep. It has created a bond that cannot be severed by the passing tide of time." Lilium told her. "But the mortal laws of this world keeps you from getting your feelings realized by the one who need deserves to know."

Navi looked to the ground below her, not daring to look Lilium in the eyes, in fear of what she truly thought of this.

"Navi." Navi forced herself to look back at Lilium. "Do you truly wish to be with the Hero of Time?", Lilium asked.

Navi managed a nervous nod. Lilium took a moment to search Navi's eyes for doubt, but she found no hint of it. She then smiled happily. Navi was again confused.

"So be it. I shall grant you that which you desire. The ability you will need for a feat such as this." She then hold her hands out around Navi, letting a blue, transparent orb form around the tiny fairy.

Navi felt a strange energy flow into her, making her glow brighten back up as marking began to appear. Mystical light blue markings began to form down her arms, on the tops of her hands, on her hips, down her legs and along her wings. The mark of Farora form on her forehead. The final marking which formed on her upper chest was a double crescent surrounding a small filler circle.

As Lilium let her hands go back to her upper chest, the orb around Navi finally disappeared. Navi's glow again receded and most of her marking vanished along with it. The only visible marking was the one on her upper chest. Navi stared at the marking for a long moment, then looked back to the still smiling Lilium.

"What just happened? I feel...strange." Navi told her.

"I have bestowed upon you the ability to change both your size and outer appearance at will. Simply concentrate of the size or the appearance and you will be able to do so. Please, do give it a try." Lilium told her.

Navi took a moment to think, rubbing her chin. "Now how tall was Link, again... uh... 6'4" feet tall?" And at that thought, Navi's markings reappeared, glowing light blue. She confusedly looked at the marking, a bit frightened as she noticed herself growing larger, everything staying within proportion. She soon grew from a mere 4 inches to 2'8" feet tall in a matter of 6 seconds and was still growing! Another short moment passed an she had shot up to 3'5" feet tall, then 4'11" and Finally stopped at 6'4" feet tall with everything still in proportion. Her markings then disappeared again, except, of course, for the one on her chest.

Looking down she noticed that her feet were now just a few inches away from the water of the spring. She didn't need the aid of flying to look someone in the face anymore, unless you counted that huge man named, Boarston. Or the giant Goron black smith.

She let herself land in the cool water, then drew her attention back to Lilium who was still much taller than her.

"Very well done, young one. Though when you return to the village of the Kokiri, you may want to withdraw you wing and change your skin tone. Those two things might give you away immediately to anyone who has seen you without your glow shrouding your appearance." Lilium pointed out. Navi thought about this and could see the entire village taking notice to this. She then made a nervous laugh, signaling that she understood. She then shook of her nervous thoughts and smiled gratefully to Lilium.

"Thank you, Great Forest Fairy Lilium." Navi said, bowing out of respect for the great fairy. Lilium put a hand to her mouth, giggling playfully. She then refocused on Navi, regaining her composure. Navi pulled back up from her bow and looked at Lilium in confusion.

"Please, Navi. Lilium alone is enough." Lilium told her. Navi smiled, blushing from embarrassment. "Now, please. Return to the Village of the Kokiri. I senses tell me your friends are waiting for you there."

Navi nodded and began to walk back the way she came. She looked back to the spring as she reached the edge of the clearing to see that Lilium had disappeared. She simply smile and continued back to the village.

She then remembered Lilium's advice and focused on retracting her wings. Her markings reappeared and her wings shrunk away and receded into her back. Next she focused of changing her skin tone to the normal humanly pink. Her skin brightened and began to change pigmentation, become a vibrant and healthy pink.

Her markings then disappeared again, except, of course, for the one on her chest.

"Much better."


++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Choice one: When Navi returns to the village, she finds that Saira doesn't recognize her at first and tells her that she she is looking for Navi. After telling her that she IS Navi, she realizes that she's telling the truth. She then tells Saira what happened, followed by a demonstration. How WILL she react? (This chapter will be written by me.)

Choice two: Make up your own path for Navi to follow.
11531211.title: Lilium's Gift

115312111.content:
While I have not visited here in a long time, I have come to see that there is someone else who might want a different result than the one I had planned out. While I still don't possess the time to add to the story I began here, I would like to give someone else a try with a third option set.

That being said, so long as no one minds, I'll be placing two more options in the second column. Don't be shy! Use the second option bar to make your own story line variant if you so wish. I will get to my storyline again sometime in the future, but for now...

Write on, Fellow Writers and Zelda Fans!
115312111.title: On Second thought... (giving other options)

1153121112.content:
Here is where you guys can put your own ideas and go through my pre-established setting with Navi as you please. Whether it's just stomping around Hyrule like an old fashion blockbuster monster, beating around the bush and messing with previously larger folks because you can now tower over everyone if you so choose, or something of your own mind, the choice is your's for the taking!

However, that being said, I saw the other option beside my own made big mistakes with timelines, fashions and technologies that do not currently exist anywhere in Hyrule. I have to caution you all as to what you try to do. Unless you suddenly fling your Navi into the future (even though you risk that Link may not exist in that future and such), you should know that Hyrule is pretty much Midieval Times.

I'm not bashing on the writer of that chapter. I'm just trying to keep the story true to it's current setting. Most of you no doubt know that there aren't very many people anywhere in the world of Hyrule, if any, that know what Jeans and most electrical devices are, much less how they could ever make them. It's pretty much simple wears like cotton Tunics, leather or wool sewn trousers, linen knit undergarments and sun dresses. Leather vests and corsets were also in style. So were blouses of both genders. Other more aged wears were present, but those are the most common types. However, for their feet, you can find that women wore sandals, heels, boots or very simple leather shoes. For men, most are either ever seen wearing the same type of shoes, the strangely named pointy ended hard-leathered boots called Winkle-pickers(Actual researched name), elven shoes, or boots. For more Royal attires, wealthy families tend to wear studded and bejeweled clothing of the same variety, but of greater quality. Some even wore capes with their family emblems sewn into them if they were trying to be distinguished. Other more unusual garments from the Hyrulian royal family included armor pieces from time to time, in case of assassination attempts made on their lives regularly, just as they happened to actual royal families in real life midieval times. And of course, there were the crowns and tiaras.

As for technology, for those who don't just use magical items and such, there isn't very much. It was extremely limited. No TVs, no cellphones, no walkytalkies or anything of the like. Electricity is still a very unpredictable thing for more than just a majority of the people. The closest people have come to utilizing it is through magical spells, mystic items, lightning rods and the light bulb, albeit a cruder version of it. Bombs exist, so we know they definitely have a grasp on fire and gunpowder passed items of odd sources.


From all this, it's signs that the midieval era they are in is either of or close to the renaissance of their world. Their history is odd indeed with all these magical items and such about, but they aren't out of Midieval era yet, so lets keep it in there, alright? If not, I suppose wander navi through a time gate or a portal or something.

Again, all of this is just to make sure you guys don't get the setting confused. I'll end here since I'm sure you all already knew all of this, or at least most of you.

Eitherway, happy writing~!


Remember. Our character is Navi. The Great Fairy, Lilium, has just given her the ability to change her own size and shape, allowing her to transform herself into a human girl of 6'4" feet. However, those same powers don't grant her the ability to magic up clothes for herself. No matter what story you go with, it may be wise to procure some clothing for her, in some way or another. Navi still seems to have remained naive to the fact that her old Fairy wears are gone thanks to her transformation destroying them, but she's bound to notice very soon... one way or another... (Remember, nothing graphic. Censor anything in your writing other than to maybe elude to nude stuff. Someone may gaze and react, but you are not allowed to describe at what. You are also not allowed to write out sexual scenes, still. I'm very certain the author would still dislike that. So please, write responsibly.)
1153121112.title: Other options for other writers.

115312112.content:
Navi, who now looked like a true human, used some of her Fairy Power to flash some clothes on, otherwise, she would be running to Hyrule Castle bare naked. She flashed on regular Teen Clothes, a Pink shirt, with Blue Jean shorts. Navi began to run, she never felt the true experience of running, because she had always flown. In the back of Navi's Head, She heard Lillium's voice once more. "Use this power correctly Navi, or bad things shall happen." She heard her say.

I would never Lillium. Navi thought. I just want to be with the one I love.

Navi continued running, and surprisingly, no-one in Kokiri Forest recognized her. Navi bought some Kokiri Boots, and slipped them on. With the Boots, Navi seemed to run even faster. About halfway to Hyrule Castle, Navi stopped to think about something. "I need a human name, Link would recognize me right away." Navi said. "Aria." She decided after a few minutes.

Navi ran to Hyrule Castle, and continued past Castle Town. She encountered the Guard at the Gate. "My name is Aria, may I please see Link, of the Royal Family." She asked. The Guard pulled out a Walkie-Talkie, and pressed the button. "Sir Link, I have some Girl named Aria from Castle Town who would like to see you." The Guard asked.

A Voice broke through, and it was Link's. "Send her in." Link said sternly. Navi was so happy, and was guided throughout the sandy path, that Link snuck through 8 years ago. The Drawbridge to the Castle lowered and Navi was gestured in. Peasants and Servants greeted Navi in. At the End of the Carpeted Hallway was Link. He was dressed in a Male Zora's Tunic. From what Info Navi had gathered was that Link wore a Tunic of the different species everyday.

"Are you Aria?" Link asked. "Yes Sir." Navi said. "If you come to my Room, I would like to talk to you." Link said. Navi's Wish had been granted, just a little time with Link.

Navi was guided by Link to his Room, and Link shut the Door behind Navi. "Aria, I think I know your true I identity." Link said. Navi gasped, but tried to keep her cool. "Navi. Why would you do this?" Link asked. "Link, I'm really sorry." Navi said. "You wanted to be with me? Haven't you?" Link deduced. "Still, Beings of Different Kinds cannot be together." "I hate that rule! I just hate it!" Navi stomped her foot.

Navi ran out of Link's room in anger, and ran out to Hyrule Field. Navi wanted to get revenge, the god-be-darned rule, and the one she loved, needed to be destroyed. She used the Power she got from Lillium to...
115312112.title: Navi's Love

1153121122.content:
Navi had transferred her love for Link, to a hatred for him. "Link needs to be punished, I hate him!" Navi said pounding on the ground. She muttered some ancient language, only fairies knew, and in a moment, Link was in Navi's Grasp, and 3 inches tall. "Link. You shouldn't have killed my love. Otherwise, I would be gentle to you." Navi said squeezing Link.

Link was quickly running out of air, and Navi's grip was only gonna get tighter. "Navi...please stop...I...can't...breath." Link choked, and Navi smiled evilly. "Sorry Link, You tortured me, by making me wait, so I'm gonna torture you." She said. "Navi...I'm...so...sorry." Link muttered before passing out. Navi found no more use for squeezing Link, so she removed her right boot, and tossed Link in there. She put the boot back on, and walked back to Kokiri Forest.

Navi made it back to Kokiri Forest, and went to Saria's House. "Hello?" Saria asked opening the Door. Saria looked worried. "Excuse me Miss, but have you seen a small Fairy, named Navi?" Saria asked. "Saria, it's me, and I have a present for you." Navi said. Saria recognized the voice, and looked in shock as Navi emptied Link out of her boot.

Saria looked at Link, and and was utterly dissapointed. Saria gently put Link in a bottle, and took Navi to the Great Deku Tree (Who had once been the Deku Tree Sprout).

"Navi. I am dissapointed in you. You should not have hurt the Hero of Time." The Deku Tree said. A Glowing Light, who was soon revealed to be Lillium, appeared next to The Deku Tree. "Navi why? I thought you said you loved Link. And Now your trying to destroy him?" Lillium said. "Great Fairy Lillium! Link must be punished. He hurt me!" Navi said. "And you hurt him, so I believe you two should be equal." Lillium said.

"Saria, bring the Hero of Time here." The Deku Tree said. "Yes Great Deku Tree." Saria said. In a Moment, Saria was back with Link, and he Flinched in Fear. "Navi, apologize, or the consequences will be severe." Lillium said. What does Navi do?
1153121122.title: Navi tortures Link.

11531211221.content:
Navi hates being punished, especially when it comes to the Great Fairies of Hyrule. "Saria, may I please be alone with Link for a Moment?" Navi asked. Link, although shrunken, still had his equipment ready, and he drew the Master Sword, in case Navi intended to harm him. Saria handed Link to Navi, and Navi walked to the Short Intersection between Kokiri Forest and The Deku Tree Sanctuary.

Navi set Link down, and kneeled down to him. "Link, I'm very sorry for all I did." Navi said, hoping Link would accept. Navi grew Link to his original height. Navi was about to walk away when Link stopped her. "Navi, you loved me, for 8 long years, and I never once saw it. So, I owe you something." Link said. He turned Navi around and gave her a quick kiss.

Navi began to tear up, and ran away. She ran as far as Hyrule could go, and unknown to her, her excessive crying caused a sudden growth spurt. Navi grew up to..
11531211221.title: Navi returns Link to normal

choices: Navi is able to revert back before Link's back
115312112211.content:
Navi curled up in a ball, and accidentally grew herself to 100ft tall. "Huh?" Navi said, tears running down her eyes. "Navi!!" Link yelled. Navi was delighted to see the one she once loved, and loved once more, riding on Epona towards her. "Navi!! What happened?" Link asked from atop his trusty steed. "I didn't deserve that kiss you gave me." Navi said, curling into a ball, crushing 50 trees and 5 Poes.

"Navi, you did." Link said. "I owed you that one thing." Navi looked down and gently picked Link up. "No, you didn't owe me. I tortured you." Navi said. "Navi! Listen! You loved me, for 8 years, I didn't know! That damn rule keeps you and me from being together!" Link yelled. Navi looked in shock, she had never heard Link curse, ever.

"Link. Do you...love me too?" Navi asked. "Even though it's destined for me and the Princess, Yes. I felt an affection. But I never thought you would feel the same way." Link said, rubbing his arm. Navi bursted into tears, and even raised the water level in Lake Hylia, by 20%. Navi, revert back to regular size, and I'm going to see the Council of Hyrule." Link said.
115312112211.title: Navi's Scared Sensation

choices: "Help Link out on his quests, an make the world a better place."
"Teach humanity a lesson on why not to treat fairies like dirt!"
11531212.content:
Navi tossed around in bed a lot that night. She wasn't able to fall asleep, and eventually decided to go fly over to the Great Deku Tree for a nighttime visit. She arrived in front of the tree and started to feel nostalgic. She remembered how this was the first dungeon that she and Link had ever cleared together. Navi wanted nothing more than to return to those days of going on adventures together with Link.

"*sigh* I wish that there was some way for me to make Link take me with him again... If only I were more useful..."

Suddenly, a mysterious voice echoed through the air.

Do you truly wish for the power to aid your friend?

"Who's there?!"

Don't you remember my voice Navi?

"Great Deku Tree? But I thought that you... Died..."

I did die, Navi... I am currently communicating with you from the grave through the power of the Kokiri Emerald...

"Wow... That emerald really has that kind of power? I know it was called a spiritual stone, but I didn't think that it actually had magical powers..."

The gem is more powerful than you could ever imagine, Navi... If you wish to help Link in his quest, take the gem. The power of your fairy magic will be magnified exponentially when funneled through the sacred stones. The emerald in particular will grant you the ability to control the size of anything at will. Collecting the other gems will grant you even greater powers. With the Goron Ruby you shall gain the power to control and create new landmasses with a mere thought, and you will be able to reshape the world in your image. The Zora sapphire grants the ability to resurrect the dead, and repair any damage that may have been caused by your powers. Once you have acquired the power of all three, you will gain far greater power than the gems could produce individually. You shall awaken to powers equivalent to the three golden goddesses who created the universe itself!

"So... You're saying that I could become a goddess?!"

Essentially, yes... Now Navi, take the Kokiri Emerald. I trust that you shall only use this knowledge for good. May luck be on your side...

The emerald then fell from the branches of the Deku Tree, and hovered in front of navi. She slowly floated toward it, and as soon as she touched the gem, her entire body began flowing with power. The emerald slowly turned to a dull gray color as its power was absorbed into the fairy. Navi had finished absorbing the power from the gem, and it was now nothing more than an ordinary rock. Without its magical powers, the stone fell to the ground with a thud. Navi felt the need to test her new powers. She began to focus her energy as her soft whitish-blue glow turned to the green color of the emerald. Navi began slowly increasing in size until she was the same size as an average human.

Now that she was human sized, the glow that once hid her body from view had faded. Her true appearance was revealed to be that of a beautiful young woman with long blue hair. She wore a white dress with blue ruffles on her shoulders, and a golden bracelet on each wrist as well as an identical anklet on each ankle. She was barefoot, and her toes wiggled at the feeling of the grass between them. Her nails were all painted blue, and she was amazingly attractive.

She basically looked like this, except with bracelets/anklets: http://fc05.deviantart.net/fs71/f/2010/2...

Looking at her new size, and realizing that she could grow bigger at any time, Navi quickly became excited.

"I have to show this to Saria! She'll be so amazed!"

Navi then flew back to Saria's house, and tried to open the door. She realized that it was locked, and remembered that she had flown through the window before. She shrank back to her original size to fly back through the open window, and regrew back to human size once inside again. She then tapped the sleeping Saria on the shoulder to wake her. Saria didn't recognize the human sized fairy, and wondered who she was.

"Who are you? How did you get into my house?"

"Saria, don't you recognize me? It's me, Navi!"

"Navi? Is that really you? How did you get to be so big? You're just as tall as me!"

"Lets just say that it was a gift from the spirit of the Deku Tree... Hey, watch this!"

Navi then shrank back to her original size, returned to human size, kept growing until her head was about to hit the ceiling of Saria house, and the returned to human size again. Saria simply stared at her in awe.

"I can control the size of anything now! Isn't that awesome?"

"Yeah... It really is! What do you plan on doing now?"

"Well... The Deku Tree said that if I got the power of the other two spiritual stones, then I would become a goddess! I think that's what I'm gonna do now; get the other two gems and absorb their power."

Saria was a bit unnerved by this statement, but she tried to remain calm. After all, Navi wasn't the type to let that power go to her head! Right?

"So what will you do after that?"

"Hmmm... I think that I'm gonna use that power to ___________."
11531212.title: Navi and the emerald

choices: Up Death Mountain; To Goron City
115312121.content:
"Hmmm... I think that I'm gonna use the power to help Link out on his quests, and make the world a better place." Navi explained. Saria was happy by Navi's answer. "Well, then you should go for that goal." Saria said. Saria, walked over to the door, and unlocked it, so Navi would not have to fly through the window. Navi waved goodbye, and left the village quickly.

When in Hyrule Field, Navi thought about being a Giantess, that was her second-most dream, and with the Kokiri Emerald, she could accomplish that dream. She thought about being a simple height of 20 feet tall. She shut her eyes, and when she opened them, she looked down upon Hyrule Field. She took an easy step, accomplishing 13 feet of a normal human in seconds.

Though, she crushed 2 Trees with every step she took in the beginning. She brushed what remained of the trees off her foot, and continued walking towards Kakariko, which was at the base of Death Mountain.

She looked over Kakariko, and many people were scared of Navi's presence. "Don't Worry. I'm not to cause you harm." Navi reassured them. But some were still scared, so one by one, she gently rubbed each of their backs. They calmed down, and Navi fluttered on, one of her toes, accidentally toppling over the branch of wood over the well.
115312121.title: A Trip to Kakariko

115312122.content:
Navi stomped her foot on Saria's Floor. "I'm gonna teach humanity why not to treat fairies like dirt." She said angrily. "And the First Fairy Abuser I punish, is you Saria!" She grew to 75 feet tall, and broke out of Saria's Home. "B.but I've never done anything to hurt Sinibi." Saria stuttered. "You abandoning her? Leaving her with Hex?" Navi asked.

Navi picked Saria up, by the tips of her fingers, and brought her to her mouth, taking a large lick. Saria was covered in Navi's saliva. "Navi. Navi, please don't!" Saria pleaded, trying to avoid certain death. "No Dice Saria. You treated Sinibi like dirt, so I'm gonna make you my dinner." Navi said. Navi tossed Saria, and swallowed her whole. Navi rubbed her stomach, as it slowly digested Saria, her screams echoing throughout Navi's Insides.

11531221.content:
(This chapter was originally written by orix )

Anju spent the morning cleaning up her beloved little inn for the comfort of her guests. It was her pleasure to run such a pleasant business in the bustling town and always loved to see familiar faces coming in to visit, and so it was with great delight that she welcomed the speedy postman on this bright morning.

"Ah, Postman! So nice to see you today!" Anju smiles.

The postman runs up to the desk and jogs in place as he takes out a package marked for Anju. "Can't talk now! Busy delivering! Sign here please!" He hands Anju a paper to sign for the delivery and hastily runs back through the door.

"Well," Anju frowns, "goodbye." She looks at the small canvas wrapped package. "I wonder who sent me this. What could it be?" She unwraps the folded package and finds a small necklace with a glowing green gem in the middle. "Oh, this is beautiful."

She tries it on immediately and observes it in a mirror nearby, "Oh, I wish I could thank them. This is such a wonderful surprise."

But little did Anju know that the real surprise was yet to come.
11531221.title: Anju's Surprise Package

1153122221.content:
(This chapter was originally written by orix )

After days and weeks and months of sitting behind that counter while hapless fools poured their money into trying again and again to solve her labyrinth, the treasure girl finally decided enough was enough. The young woman (let's call her Tia to make this easier) called as many contestants as she could together one evening after the store was closed and promised to show them how it was done.

All the men waited in the lobby while Tia walked effortlessly through the maze without disturbing a single trick panel that would block her path. "It's all so simple! See!" She says as she stands in front of the large treasure chest. She puts her hands on the edge and flips open the lid. "And here's the treasure!"

She bends down to reach into the large box and trips. She falls into the chest and the lid closes shut on her. The onlookers immediately spring to action, "We have to help her!"

"First one there gets the treasure!"

They all race forward and the maze erupts left and right and blocks their path again and again as everyone bumps into walls and one another and lose track of the treasure chest. Just then, there's a loud rumbling and the chest breaks open. Tia, the purple haired, pink clothed shop girl is growing at an incredible rate. The roof begins to strain as her back bumps against it.

"We have to get out of here!" Everyone shouts, only they have just as tough a time going back as they did going forward.
1153122221.title: The Real Treasure.

Link stirred slightly, and felt his eyes open slightly. He could sense the earth underneath him shifting about back and forth.


Am I dead? He wondered, and then shook himself. No, Midna wouldn’t do that…

A dizzy sensation ran through him. Where was he?


He heard a low giggle above him, and he sprang upwards, and then found himself sliding about on the ground, which was oddly soft and yielding. He gave a short howl as he tumbled about until he suddenly landed in a small opening in the ground. Then, he looked up and gave a yelp of shock.


Midna’s large face was directly above him, grinning downwards.


Link sprang upwards in sudden realization, and found himself nearly tumbling out from between her breasts.


“Enjoying yourself?” Midna chuckled, amused at Link’s shock at her new physical form. “I would have expected you to be…what’s wrong? Are you unhappy being here?”


Link looked nervously at Midna. A sly grin began to creep onto the Twili’s face. Link half moaned, knowing Midna was about to come up with some sort of crazy idea.

1153312.content:
(This chapter was originally written by orix )

As the great battle draws to a close, the impish Midna is restored to her beautiful Twili form as the honored Twilight Princess. Her time in this strange land of light, helping its people, working as a team with Link. She hates to admit that she'll miss it, but she knows she can't stay here. She must return to her people in the twilight realm.

Midna, the Twilight Princess, Zelda, Princess of Hyrule, and Link the courageous hero travel to the infamous mirror atop the desert prison. Zelda and Link are just as upset to see her go as Midna is to leave. The mirror shines and opens the portal to Midna's realm and she vows this won't be the last she sees of them.

As Midna steps toward the portal, something strange happens in Zelda and Link. Their Triforce pieces begin to glow on their hands as the mirror grows brighter and they feel themselves being pulled toward the spinning portal. Midna watches as everything begins to shake and break apart, but there's nothing she can do as she and everything in the land of Hyrule and beyond is sucked through the portal.

As the world reforms on the other side, two worlds collide. The land of Hyrule pieces itself back together while the kingdom of twilight floats in the odd sky overhead. Midna is back in the realm she rules and brought with her the world she came to love, only something odd happened in the transition. All of Hyrule is a fraction of its former size! Midna looks down over the edge of her floating domain and sees the familiar landscape below. She floats down toward the land and sees her two heroic companions atop the tower.

11533122.content:
(This chapter was originally written by Chozo )

All over the land of Hyrule humans, Gorons, Zora, and all other beings watched in terror as a woman the size of a mountain flutters down from the night sky in the area of Gerudo province. None of them had ever seen this woman before, and were frightened by her dark - yet beautiful - appearance. They had only just seen Hyrule castle restored to normal, and shook their heads in despair over this new and even more powerful threat.

But the Twilight Princess didn't intend any harm to the people of Hyrule. Midna set her feet down on the sand surface of Geurdo desert as delicately as she could, but at her unfathomably large size even this gentle contact produced violent tremors, and created rifts and cracks in the crust of Hyrule.

"Oops!" Midna winced, observing the unintentional damage she was causing to the tiny world. She turned her attention over to the Mirror tower, where Link and Zelda where still standing, and leaned her enormous face in for a closer look. "Oh my! You both are so tiny now!" she said, making out the tiny figures atop the tower. Her gargantuan face alone was the size of a typical Hyrule village!

Link and Zelda trembled at the size of their friend. Even though she didn't behave threateningly, Midna had the power to crush them both with just the slightest touch of her finger. Finally, Zelda attempted to communicate with her fellow Princess, but to no avail... she was just too tiny for Midna to comprehend.

It seemed as if there would be no way for them to communicate with their colossal friend, but then Link remembered his equipment, and began to consider his options. Was there something on him he could use that could amplify their voices so Midna could understand?

1153322221.content:
"Bye, fellas! You boys come back soon~"

With a sweet goodbye to her last customers, Telma, the busty own of her own tavern, locked the door and slumped against it while letting out an exhausted sigh. "Two busy weeks busting my back in a row. I can't remember the last time I worked this hard before. I guess it's a good thing that those soldiers aren't as cowardly as they use to be, so at least it makes for good business."

It was true. Two weeks ago, Hyrule was blanketed under a cloud of twilight, rendering the soldiers cowardly against the beasts who invaded the castle. Telma closed her bar out for soldiers who wouldn't stand in a fight. Now that the twilight has been long dissipated, and the soldiers' morale was boosted, Telma opened her tavern back to the soldiers, and she amassed a decent amount of payment from her armored customers.

"Now if only they didn't make such a mess of this place, that would be just as fine," Telma grumbled as she looked around the messy interior of her beloved tavern. "I should put up a sign telling the customers to not make a mess. Or maybe I should hire a busboy to help with the cleaning. I have enough Rupees to pay them a weekly salary and then some."

Standing up, Telma cricked her back and heaved a sigh. "But first, I need something to drink. Something to reward myself for my hard work and make cleaning this mess tolerable at the same time." She giggled at her own quip and went behind the counter where she inspected her bottles for something delicious to wet her whistle and to get her hide. Inside the cupboards, she set aside any bottles that she didn't feel that would provide both flavor and mild potency.

Looking inside, she came across a strange glass bottle filled with a crimson liquid. She took it out, popped the cork and sniffed it. Fermented wildberries, hydromelons, and a few other ingredients she couldn't pinpoint. Tilting the bottle to her lips, Telma took a sip of the liquid, letting the strong fruit flavor pass over her tongue, down her throat, and into her stomach. She cringed at the flavor. It burned a small fire in her stomach. It certainly did a good job making her head lighter than air.

"Oh, that's some strong stuff," Telma told herself. Then she felt that fire in her stomach course through her body, tingling her nervous system with unnatural rising internal warmth. She clutched her stomach as her body throbbed as hard a Goron's drumbeat. For each throb she felt, she felt herself getting bigger... and bigger... and bigger... Her unnatural growth spurt...
1153322221.title: Telma

1211.content:
He's always been big for his age. Well, that's what everyone else thought. At one point, he had actually been a little on the short side. Wait, I'm probably confusing you right now. Let's backtrack a bit. Keep in mind, this may take a while, so bear with me. His name is Link. You know, the Hero of Time, savior of Hyrule, all that jazz. Anyways, as I'm sure you know, Zelda sent him back after he rescued the country because she felt he deserved a normal life. BIG MISTAKE! Not only did she cause his fairy companion to leave him, she ...err... more or less messed up on the song to send him back. Heh-heh. Hey, in her defense, her fingers slipped. That kind of happens when you play a porcelain instrument in silk gloves. No grip, you know? Back on track, her little (or should I say big) flub kind of messed with Link's body. As you know, a Hylian's body grows until they reach a certain age. Call it puberty. Well, Zelda's song messed with that part of Link, causing his body to never stop growing and also causing his body to grow faster than normal. Let me put it this way, you ever met a 16 year old Hylian approximately 32 feet tall? No? didn't think so. Anyways, Link didn't notice his growth until he left from Termina. While he was trying to find his way back to Kokiri forest , he would notice Epona having an increasingly difficult time supporting his weight. Now, he would have easily labeled it is a weak horse in need of proper nourishment had he not noticed his tightening clothes. Even he knew that you don't grow a foot in a month. Now, this could have deterred him, but he kept strong. He eventually arrived in Kokiri forest after about two months, all six feet of him. Mido almost had a heart attack seeing his former victim almost twice his height, not to mention his...err...lack of proper clothes or his carrying of the young filly. It was hilarious! Long story short, Mido wanted Link gone but Saria and the rest of the Kokiri wanted Link to stay. Guess who won? DING DING DING! WE HAVE A WINNER! Link stayed in the forest and adapted over time to his growing body. It was a little awkward at times, but he managed to make it work. He even got to re-meet Zelda when she came to visit the Deku Tree. Something about protecting some instrument or other. I can't remember off the top of my head. Now Link was twelve when this happened, so he was about fourteen feet tal to Zelda's meager five feet. She was instantly interested in the giant boy in the loincloth with the pointy hat (Saria was always making one larger for him. What's Link without his signature hat?). They became friends and she visited him as often as she could. They even became smitten with each other. and that brings us to the present day.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------
"Link....Liiiiiink..." Link rolled in his sleep.

"Five more minutes....." He heard an exasperated sigh from below.

"Oh come one Link, you promised you'd come with me to the sacred meadow...." Link groaned. It was too early to be awake. He opened his eyes slowly, squinting in the bright sunlight that leaked from the deku tree's leaves. That was one thing he hated about his lofty stature; he had to wake up when the sun rose. Yawning, he arched his back, feeling the discs in his spine pop into place. He smiled to himself, smelling the comforting scent of the Great Deku tree. scratching his back he stood to his full stature, a whopping 32 feet tall. Scratching at his messy mop of hair, he heard feminine giggle from below. Smiling, he looked down into the face of his dearest friend, the little girl called Saria.

"Good morning Saria. How are you?" Link asked groggily Saria giggle into her hand before placing her hands on her hips in mock exasperation. She plastered a pout on her face, one Link could easily see was fake.

"You promised you would go with me to the sacred meadow first thing in the morning. and here I am and you're still asleep." Link couldn't help but smirk.

"Aw yes, but i also said that it's a very bad idea..." Link began to crouch down,. "to wake..." Saria started smiling. Her favorite part was coming up. "A SLEEPING GIANT!" As soon as Link bellowed his line, He tickled Saria's belly with his huge finger. She squealed, a sound that couldn't be heard above Link's bellowing laughter.

"Ahaha! Lin *hahaha* stop it! *hahahahaha* I can't breathe!" Link laughed once more before scooping Saria into his large hand, allowing her to catch her breath. He smiled and put her close to he heart, enveloping her with both hands in how version of a hug.

"You big lug! You want to suffocate me!?" Saria shouted in mock horror, pounding on his chest.

"I'll let you go if you hug me back!" Saria sighed, but smiled. Twisting her body, she wrapped her arms around as much of Link's chest as she could. It wasn't much, but Link could still feel the love.

"OY! You two! As much as I love you two, would you get out of here! I'm trying to sleep!" the Deku sprout shouted. As much as he was a god, he was still a sarcastic child who need his rest.

"Sorry Great Deku Sprout," Link and Saria said in unison. Link strode out of the Deku meadow and stepped over the stone cliff separating it from the village., carrying Saria in his cupped hand the entire time.
--------------------------
"You know Saria," Link said while lying on his back in the meadow, "I need a new loincloth. This one's getting tight again. Saria put her ocarina down in her lap.

"come on Link, that's the second one this month!" Link winced. While none of the Kokiri explicitly sated how difficult he unintentionally made their lives (except for Mido, but he never liked Link to begin with), Link was aware of just how much they had to do for him in order for him to be semi-comfortable in the forest.
"I'm sorry Saria," Link said in a low voice, "I really am. But I can' control my growth. And I think I hit another growth spurt. I can seriously feel my body stretching right now." Link felt terrible. He really did. While he did enjoy being this tall, it was horribly inconvenient at times. He needs a lot to eat and will usually go to the outskirts of the forest and tear up old bushes and trees and eat those. While not delicious, it does fill him up. Sometimes he gets barrels of Lon Lon milk from Malon, whom he saved when she was stranded in Hyrule field when the wagon's wheel broke. He heard her screams when the skeletons rose from the ground around midnight. He fought them off and stayed with her all night until she could properly fix the wheel in the morning (this involved Link holding the wagon up while Malon replaced the wheel with a new one she brought along. Link's hands were too big for anything else). Link and Malon were still great friends and he would still play with Epona, who wasn't afraid of him despite the huge size difference.

"Link, don't feel bad. It's just a bad time for us all, that's all. We're still making new cloth. could you please hold up for a couple more days?" Saria asked sympathetically. She could only imagine Link's discomfort. Link sighed, but agreed. Smiling, Link propped himself up on his elbows, looking down on her.

"So Saria, you got me up this early. You want to do something?" Saria smiled shyly, meeting his gaze.

"well..."

122.content:
Sitting atop his favorite tree the Skull Kid softly played his pan-pipes. The early morning had been very quiet thus far, and only a few birds had so much as made a sound. Skull Kid had grown accustomed, if not reluctantly, to solitude however the peace did grow tedious quickly. It was as he was wishing that Tatl and Tael had accompanied him that Skull Kid finally picked up on a rustling in the brush.

To Skull Kid's surprise it was none other than the same mask salesmen from which he had stolen Majora's Mask shortly before he had been taken over. On one hand Skull Kid had a bit of a vendetta against all grown ups, and would usually attempt to chase them from the forest, however the salesmen often had interesting things worth taking. Skull Kid had undoubtedly biten off more than he could chew with Majora's Mask, and he for a moment thought that he might owe the man free passage, at least once. It was then that a strange mask on the side of the cart caught his eye. It did not look like much but radiated an aura that Skull Kid could not oppose. Entranced he leaped down in a flurry of stones. The rocks knocked the salesmen back and Skull Kid took his opening. With the mask in his grasp Skull Kid was unable to help putting it on.

Light flooded the grove for a moment and then all melted back into shade. Or at least it did for the salesmen; Skull Kid was now facing the brightness of the morning sun over Hyrule. In amazement he glanced down to find himself dwarfing even the highest trees in the forest; they only reached his ankles!
