131.content:
Sitting alone in her castle, Princess Zelda felt lonely. The loneliness was eating away at her heart. Where's Link? When will he return? She was tired, tired of being alone.

Pulling out a book of all their past memories, Zelda was looking at the past with an optimistic attitude. She loved to remember the good times, and dreaded the bad. Mysteriously falling out of the scrap book was a piece of paper labeled "The Spell of Reduction".
131.title: Memories are small.

1311.content:
Zelda was completely intrigued by the spell looked through many of her families old spell books but none of them had any information on that particular spell. She was just about to cast it when she a servant came to tell her she had duties to attend too.

By the time she was done it was time for dinner. After dinner Zelda began to yawn she normally she wouldn't bed so early but she was tired and decided to go to bed. After going to her room and changing into her night gown Zelda noticed the stray piece of paper on the table.

Zelda proceeded to cast the spell. When she was finished her body started to glow bright. Soon after the light subsided and Zelda proceed to examine herself. "Nothing out of the ordinary." she thought to herself. She then thought maybe the effect was long term so she tried to stay up but before she knew it she was asleep.

Morning came and Zelda peaceably woke up she slowly opened her eyes to see something was wrong her view was completely blocked by and soft white object, also she felt something pressing against her body. She started to crawl out of bed it took almost a minute before she saw light.

As she crawled out of the sheets she was horrified by what she saw the paper was al large as her room normally was. Her bed was a big as the whole castle. She had shrunken to a few inches in height.

Shocked by this she started screaming which was interuppted by a loud knocking sound. Before long the door opened reveling the knocking came from...
1311.title: Spell Bound

choices: The Sheets get put in the wash.
13111.content:
Zelda watched as the cleaning lady came into her room. She had taken the piece of paper and place it on Zelda's desk. Then she started to take the sheet's off the bed and bundle them up.

Zelda again yelled as loud as she could but the servant could not hear her whatsoever. Zelda then started running to the opposite end of the bed but because of her shrunken size she was unable to out run speed of the servant's folding speed.

Plus fact she was still in her night gown didn't make it any easier to run in. She soon was trapped in a folded sheet which of course was being taken to the laundry room to be washed.

Zelda tried to pull herself out of the sheets but was unable to due to her reduced state. The sheets were placed on the ground before being put in the wash. Zelda felt the movement subside. She figured she could crawl out of them.
13111.title: The Mini Princess

choices: Go to Impa's room and wait.

Zelda crawled out of the sheets as fast as she could just when she reached the edge of them the sheets started to ascend. She squeeze out in the knick of time.

Now standing inches tall in a castle full of giants she pondered whe she could go to get hep from. As she seen most of the castle staff could be potential threats. The only person who she could trust at this point was Impa.

"My faithful, and loyal attendant could help me if I could find her." Zelda said. The only problem was that she knew Impa was known not to be in her room in the castle. It took hours before she usually found at her normally.

At her current size I could take days maybe even weeks but at this time there wasn't much of a choice. But what ever she did sher wasn't just going to sit there doing nothing.

When she peered down the corner she overheard a conversation between two guards and the Capt. of the Guards.

"Did you find it." the Captain asked. "No sir it got away we checked everyroom in the castle but Princess Zelda's room and lady Impa's room." the first guard said. "Sir can we please take a break we're tired and hungry?" the second guard asked. "You mean to tell me to of my best men can't catch a mangy street dog." the captain yelled.

"Dog!" Zelda said still peering around the corner. Just then a large blast of air sent Zelda to her knees. Turning around she saw a 12-foot dog (well at least to her) looking down at her growling.

"Wait Link I thought you were going to help me!" Zelda said as Link chased the dog. Zelda was sitting alone in a marketplace full of people that could mistaken her for a number of different things.

13111111111.title: Who's more important?

131111111112.content:
THUMP! "What the-?" Zelda cried as a strange barrier suddenly appeared all around her. Without warning, the huge barrier swept under her feet and pulled her into the air. Suddenly, a metallic CLING was heard as a giant shadow was cast. "Wait a minute... Am I... IN A JAR?" the princess cried.

Sure enough, she was. Looking up, she saw the form of a gigantic shopkeeper carrying the glass and walking toward a building. "Let me out! What do you think you're doing? Do you know who I am?" she cried. It was no use: the shopkeeper, obviously unable to hear her, proceeded into the shop and set the jar on a high shelf before taking his place behind the counter. "Great. Looks like there's no way out now." Zelda said to herself.

A little while later, a figure entered the shop holding a large bag of rupees and pointing toward Zelda's jar. From where she was, the shrunken princess couldn't tell who the figure was. As she was brought to the counter, however, she was able to get a good look at the person who was purchasing her.
131111111112.title: Sold! To... Wait, Who Are You?

choices: To the seven sages, to get help
To his house, to have fun with her
1311111111121.content:
"Link!" Zelda cried, immediately relieved to find her hero hadn't forgotten about her. As Link exited the store, he took the lid off the jar and allowed Zelda to speak. "See? Bet you thought that I would ditch you, didn't you? Well, you'll be happy to know that Sammy is safe and sound, and so are you!"

The mention of the dog's name caused Zelda's smile to fade. "Oh, Link! How could you have left me to go chase some stupid dog! Really, I could have been in serious danger back there and you just ran off and... HEY!" she cried as Link put the top back on.

"Come on, Zelda, be more grateful. I had to pay top rupee for what the guy said was an 'enchanted living Princess Zelda doll.'" Link said, still in his jocular mood. "Anyway, we'll have you taken to some place safe in no time!"

Where exactly is he taking her?
1311111111121.title: They're Never Just Happy To Be Rescued

13111111111212.content:
Link opened the jar and set it on a table when he reached his destination. Setting the jar on its side, he allowed Zelda to finally walk out of the glass tunnel that had been holding her. "Wait a minute, what are we doing here? Link, is this your house?"

To her displeasure, Zelda was met with a huge finger playing with her hair as a response. "Cut it out!" she cried. "Hee hee hee, your voice sounds all funny when it's tiny like that." Link joked. "C'mon, Zelda, let's have fun! We hardly ever see each other any more, and look at you! We don't know if you'll ever be this small again, so let's have fun with your new size while we can!"

"Link, are you insa-WHA!" Zelda cried as the giant picked her up. "Now let's see..."Link said, thinking. "I know!"
13111111111212.title: Not Exactly A Hero, Huh?

choices: Link says no and Zelda has to give him a massage now
Link says yes and that she can do it when she grows back
131111111112121.content:
Zelda looked at him, appalled. "Massage your feet? Are you serious?" Though, she had little time to give him more backlash for such a ridiculous request because he was already busy putting her back onto the table. As he emited a large sigh of relief, she looked to each side of her, finding two gigantic boots, leather faded and dirty. She even saw the remains of some bugs which had been unknowingly crushed under the Hero of Time's feet. She shuddered at the thought that her fate could end just like one of those bugs if she wasn't turned back quickly. "Please, Link, you have to help me change back! "

"But princess! I never get to spend time with you anymore. I just want to sit back and relax for a bit. You should be grateful for all of the times I've saved you, including this one! I deserve something as small as a foot massage from you." The serious look on his face went to one of pleading. "Please, Zelda? For me?" He gave her puppy dog eyes as she stared back at him angrily thinking.

"Well... You're not wrong that you do deserve this considering how many times you've gotten me out of trouble.. But can't we do this when you get me back to normal size? Or one of my servants can do it for you!"
131111111112121.title: Even heroes get sore feet

choices: Link decides that she isn't doing well enough
Link think's she's doing much better
1311111111121211.content:
Link grunted angrily at her. "What, is it too much work for a princess to be massaging a foot? Well maybe it's too much work for this hero to save you!" He folded his arms and pouted. Zelda was getting the feeling that he wasn't joking and took the massage seriously enough to not want to help her. She wasn't sure if it was his stubbornness or if it really meant that much to him to get a massage from Zelda, even at this size, but she decided it didn't matter. What mattered was getting out of this predicament as soon as possible.

"Wait! Okay... Fine, I'll massage your feet." Link's mood immediately changed and he was very excited to hear her say this.

"You will?!" He exclaimed.

"Only if you promise that you'll help me change back as soon as possible." She sighed, accepting defeat (no pun intended). Link, very happy with this turn of events, didn't waste any time and took off his boots. One after another a putrid smell filled the air. Zelda coughed and covered her nose. "Link! When was the last time you changed your socks? Or even washed your feet?"

"Well.. Let's just say it's been a long time since I've had enough downtime to just relax." He chuckled as he wiggled his toes through his very off-colored socks Zelda looked up at the very, very dirty socks and gagged a little, wondering why she associated with Link. Well, it isn't really his fault they get this bad, he doesn't have time because of her after all. She sighed and walked towards the giant feet.

She started massaging as best as she could at her height by rubbing her hands into the squishy, wet fabric. She was disgusted by the feeling of this but had no use to move on. Link groaned above her, "Is that the best you can do?" and Zelda was shocked. She couldn't do much else at her size.

"Well... I guess I could try harder, though I don't know how much of a difference it will make." She mentally prepared herself and drew in a lot of breath before moving towards his foot with her whole body. She began to rub herself as hard as she could into his foot, not even sure how much of a difference she was making in the first place.
1311111111121211.title: Link doesn't want to wait

choices: Try to talk to the dog.
Crawl under the door into the room.
131111112.content:
Zelda though it over for a second. She figured she would be much safer with Impa who she trusted completely. As she walked away from the Link the dog hopped off his arm and started to chase her again. Link looked down at his dog chasing what appeared to be a small bug.

"He must be chasing bugs again." Link said sighing. Zelda running as fast as she could from the dog who was gaining on her fast. Being a princess Zelda was not physically active and was barely keeping ahead of the dog. Panting heavily she stopped at the nearest door.

Looking back she saw the dog running toward her with his big floppy tongue sticking out. Before long she saw the dog's shadow looming over her she braced herself as the dog licked her knocking her off her feet.

Now covered in slobber Zelda looked at her options as the dog once again approached her.
131111112.title: No way

choices: Use Nayru's Love for protection in the dog's stomach
Try to escape with Farore's Wind
1311111121.content:
Zelda knew that it would be too risky to crawl away, so she turned around to reason with the dog. "Hey, stop that," she said. The dog barked, and then licked Zelda again. "Um...please?" asked Zelda. The dog licked her again. Its tongue was so sticky and slimy that it actually lifted her a few feet off the ground after every lick.
"O...kay," said Zelda slowly, "I like you too." She had no idea why the dog was licking her. Then she realized, and opened her eyes wide. The dog licked her one more time, this time the tongue wrapping around her waist. It was going to swallow her! Zelda charged up a ball of fire in one hand. "Din's Fire!" she cried, and the fire propelled out, blowing the dog back.
Zelda fell down. The dog fell back and whimpered. It then barked angrily. Before Zelda could even stand up, the dog pounced onto her. It flung her into the air, and caught her in its mouth, gulping her down.
1311111121.title: Don't try to talk with dogs

13111111211.content:
Zelda screamed as the pulsating throat muscles forced her down the giant tunnel of death. She had to get out of here. Being licked by the dog was enough. Getting eaten by it was too much. She could attempt to use Farore's Wind. That would teleport her out. Then she remembered that she hadn't set a teleportation point. What else could she do to save herself from the digestion?

Nayru's Love. Then she could encase herself in a barrier so she couldn't be digested. But that wouldn't last too long. She was already weak from the constant squeezing of the dog's throat. Anyways, she focused and began to create a barrier around herself.

Something strange happened. The barrier exploded. The dog's eyes popped open, and it burped loudly. Zelda was propelled out of the dog's throat, with Nayru's Love to protect herself from fall damage. She rolled next to Link's feet.

"Zelda?" asked Link, "Is that you-oh my god. You weren't just swallowed by the dog were you?" Zelda cut the barrier and stood up, covered in slime from inside the dog. "Now that you know I'm here, can you find out what's wrong with me?" "What's wrong with you?" asked Link sarcastically, "You're three inches tall!"
13111111211.title: Escape

13111111212.content:
Zelda screamed as the pulsating throat muscles forced her down the giant tunnel of death. She had to get out of here. Being licked by the dog was enough. Getting eaten by it was too much. She could attempt to use Farore's Wind. That would teleport her out. She then held out her hand, which began to grow with green light.

Nothing happened. Why didn't anything happen? Zelda realized that she hadn't set a teleportation point outside the dog's belly yet. She was doomed. Zelda slowly passed out as she was swallowed down into the giant encompassing stomach. Outside, the dog ran back to Link, and then rested at his feet to digest its food.

What made matters worse was that Mido had closed off the waterfall area which means nobody could cool off. So Saria was sitting in the grass next to the small stream near her house. She was staring up at a tree that was providing shade for her.

The wind started to pick up a little bit. Saria gave out a sigh of relief. A small twig broke off the tree and fell into the stream. A piece of paper blew in Saria's face. After she peeled it off her face she examined it.

In the shade of the tree she could not read the paper properly. So she stood up off the ground and stepped into the light which caused her tos tand in the stream. The cold water barely came up to her ankles. Upon furter examination she saw a musical scale and notes written on the back.

The notes were alined in a musical manner. The song was titled "The song of the Minish." Saria had never heard of such a song. Eager to try it out she pulled out her Ocarina and studied the notes scribbled on the paper. She then played the song after which a blinding flash of surrounded her. Suddenly...

Still holding on to the log she turned her head around and saw a large water fall a little ways down. Saria decided to scream for help. "Help Me!"
she yelled as loud as possible Her cry apparently fell on deaf ears.

The rough spot was her name carved into it. Saria put 2 and 2 together and realized she some how had shrunk was sitting on her Ocarina. She Immediately started to panic.

1321121221121.content:
Saria into the cold bottle of milk and shivered as that bottle was in an open icebox. "Nnnnnowww, I cccan't even rrrreach the tttop of the bottle. Hhhow do I ggggget out offer hhhhhhere?" Saria shivered as she looked all around the bottle piecing together how to get out of her new predicament. As she though, she also thought of why there would be a bottle of milk on such a bit summer's day in a small (relatively speaking) icebox.. With that, Saria came to the horrifying conclusion that this milk was going to be sold, and her fears came true when a giant redhead of 17 years overshadowed the bottle.

Malon had just finished milking the cows and then boiled the milk to free it from germs and kept the milk in bottles inside the icebox to keep them cool for customers. As one can imagine, Malon was sweating buckets by the end and wanted to have a cool drink of milk all to herself. However, there's a policy that Talon made that only unsold milk can be drunk by employees, and with such a hot day out today Malon didn't like her chances. That's why Malon had a milk bottle reserved for herself by leaving it open and filling it with more milk than usual. "That little trick oughta save me some milk at the end o' the day." Malon breathed under her breathe as she heaved the icebox onto the art and started pushing her wares to Hyrule market.

Saria was a bit refreshed after riding on the bird, yet she didn't know if she had enough strength to stay afloat for a long time. She could only hope that her bottle would spill over and she could escape. Malon also had a tough time pushing her cart all the way to market. It may not have been a dire situation like Saria, but it sure felt that way to Malon. It was a 10 minute walk to town and those 10 minutes were torture to the young woman. She felt herself sweating like a pig, which cause her cute white shirt to stick to her top which left little to the imagination. "Thank goodness I have such a long dress skirt, otherwise some of the 'gentlemen' in the market soul never leave me be. It's also good that I got a spare white shirt in the cart, but that won't help unless I cool down first" Malon lamented in her thoughts as she trudged her cart all the way to town.

Finally, after 10 excruciating minutes of travel and 3 minutes of set up, Malon was open for business. She put a special marked cap on top of her secret bottle so that it wouldn't go bad and so she could remind herself of which bottle was here's. She couldn't see the green speck in her milk, causing Saria to lose all hope of being found. After 30 minutes of selling milk (which also included running out the rubberneckers who only wanted to see Malon and not her stock), Malon couldn't help the thirst anymore and she quickly grabbed her bottle to drink. At least, that was her plan until Princess Zelda had appeared and taken interest in her bottle. "Hello Malon. How are you today?" "Oh, I'm doing fine, except for this blasted heat steaming me up while I work." "I noticed that bottle of milk you have and I would like to buy it from you, if you would be so kind." Malon was a bit conflicted here, seeing as she wanted to drink her milk for almost an hour now, but refusing the royal house wouldn't do to well. Malon decided to...
1321121221121.title: An open bottle of Lon Lon Milk

13211212211211.content:
"I'm sorry princess, but I have been saving this bottle for myself all day and today has been very hard on me. Maybe I can sell you a different bottle instead?" Malon pleaded to her royal highness. Zelda understood Malon's plight and had decided to accommodate her by simply choosing another bottle instead of the one Malon had. The magic property of the bottle that she sensed earlier could be easily fixed if it did affect the farmgirl, so Zelda saw no issue with Malon refreshing herself with that bottle. "Okay Malon, I shall have a different bottle of milk then." Zelda graciously replied and she left to browse the market's wares. Saria was thus left unaware in the bottle and she saw no hope of being found in the drink.

Malon soon found that now was a good time to take her milk break, so she placed a sign on her cart saying "Out to lunch." Malon then uncapped the bottle and she began to slowly bring the bottle to her plush pink lips and enjoy her drink. Malon tried to slowly savor the milk, but when the first drop of milk landed on Malon's tongue she seriously reconsidered savoring her milk and decided to down it as soon as possible to cool her sweat-soaked body. Saria felt the milk turn into a raging river as Malon placed the bottle's opening in her mouth, showing Saria a dark and misty cavern of saliva. Saria's body forced itself to swim against the milk as she felt her survival instinct kick in, all the while all she could her was a loud and continuous GULP... ULP... ULP... ULP... ULP... coming from Malon's throat into the bottle. When Saria's feet made contact with Malon's lips, the bottle straightened upward as Malon needed to to take a breathe and Saria fell into the half empty bottle. Saria felt her body just give up on her as she pushed herself beyond her limits. She was sweating buckets herself and she decided to just go with the flow at this point because she didn't see any way out of this situation. To cement this decision, Saria decided to drink some of the milk around her, despite the fact that there was her own sweat and Malon's backwash in it. After swallowing a mouthful of milk, Saria felt herself cool down a bit and she began to understand why Malon was in such a rush to finish it off.

Malon felt it would be a good time to change out of her sweat covered shirt into her fresh shirt now that she freshened up a bit. Malon took her shirt in one hand and her bottle in the other as she headed for a secluded area to change. She unwittingly shook the bottle and caused small waves for Saria to deal with, but Saria simply floated on her back as she watched her captor walk to parts unknown. Malon quickly found a secure room to undress and she began to remove her shirt. Saria was slightly embarrassed by the well-endowed titanic teen wearing a black lacy bra in front of her, but mostly Saria was trying to accept the fact that she would help keep that body looking beautiful, if only for a little while more. As Malon put on her clean shirt, she thought she may as well finish her milk here seeing as her sign made a clear reason for her abscenece. The bottle was once again lifted towards Malon's lips and Saria simply watched as the milk coasted her along into the misty, warm, and milk-scented mouth. Saria made contact with Malon's tongue, yet she didn't go down the throat immediately as she expected. Malon was much more eager to to savor the drink now that she was cooler and she decided to swish her milk all around her mouth to get as much flavor out as possible. Saria was licked and pushed all over Malon's mouth, to the roof of the mouth to being rubbed against every tooth of Malon's pallet to being shoved into each cheek of of the mouth by the giant muscle residing in the cave. Malon felt ecstatic about savoring her milk as she was able to taste the sweetness and a very small hint of a forest mint flavor that brought the whole experience together. However, there was still more milk to go through, and Malon didn't have all day to relax when there was work to be done.

Saria felt a strong suction force on her body as she realized that it was time for Malon to finish her off. A resounding GULP was all Saria could hear at first, then she heard the gentle soothing beating of Malon's heart before she finally landed in the stomach. Saria's fatigue finally caught up to her as she decided to sleep as the area around her began to fill up with more milk. As the last drop of milk danced on Malon's tongue, she let out a satisfied gasp and held her hands to her stomach for a moment before regaining her composure and getting back to work. And so, the day passed on as a regular day for Malon as Saria simply disappeared into her body, becoming nutrients that helped Malon maintain her youthful beauty.
13211212211211.title: Keep her bottle and sell the princess a differe...

1321121221122.content:
A miniscule small from a normal perspective was made when Saria had unwittingly swan-dived into the washbin. Saria quickly resurface, coughing up soap and water as she tried to regain her breath. "Hah, hah, well I should be a bit safer now than I was before." Saria exasperated as she tried to breathe, yet fate decided to play a cruel trick on her optimism. Small tremors that became louder as they approached alerted Saria that someone had planned to use the washbin she was in and she tried to swim out before it was to late. She reaches the rim of the bin but found that it was too high for her to climb out, and when she realised this there was a shadow looming right above her.

Malon was sweaty and tied from another hard day of work at the farm, and she couldn't wait to relax and get herself clean. She had already set up the washbin in advance of her last job so that she could get right to the relaxing. She picked up the washbin with some difficulty and took it inside one of the empty farmhouse, out of precaution that there would be a peeping tom nearby. Saria was splashed all around as Malon had carried the water to get ready for her bath, and she was having a miserable time. The waves would push her under or around the bin and whenever Saria looked skyward to her captor, she would see a determined, sweaty Melon that looked onward toward her destination. Malon's sweat would at times fall from her glistening arms into the washbin and cause an eruption of water for Saria to dodge.

Finally, Malon had gotten the washbin inside the farmhouse and wasted no time getting undressed for her bath. Saria stared in awe and embarrassment as she saw the well-endowed 17-year old Malon strip from her white dress to her lacy black underwear and matching bra and then strip even further down to her birthday suit. Saria had little time to be flustered for as soon as the redhead finished removing the last article of clothing she went straight into the washbin, leaving Saria in a panic.

"Ooohhh, that's cold!" Malon exclaimed as she stepped into the washbin with both feet, with the water reaching up to her valve, where Saria had slammed into due to the waves. "Oh, ohh, aaaaaaaaahhhhhhh, that feels too good." Malon sighed as she slowly slid herself into the bath. Malon's descent had pushed Saria to the back end of the bin, where Malon's feet resided. Malon soon rested her head on the rim and decided to relax for a while, as her long red hair flowed over the water, almost above her belly button.

Saria realised that she would have to get Malon's attention to survive this ordeal. Although resting on the bird allowed Saria to recuperate some of her strength, she was nearly wiped out from the washbin's moving, so she swam at a crawling speed. Along the way, Saria was able to see through the water below and see all of Malon. She saw Malon's toenails painted blue to match her eyes leading to her calluses yet cute gigantic feet. Her feet lead into her legs which were toned from years of running with the horses. Saria then saw Malon's private place as she swam over it, feeling embarrassed and aghast at how much larger it was than her. She quickly swam past it to get her mind off of such thoughts. Saria soon swam over Malon's torso and was a bit amused at how cute her belly button was. At this point, Saria had reached Malon's flowing hair, meaning now she had to swim through water, soap suds, and a river of hair to reach her goal, which further tired the miniscule girl out. Finally after about 20 minutes, Saria had reached Malon's breasts, some of which was sticking out of the water. Saria was dead tired and decided to rest on the left island. Unfortunately, Malon had felt a little tickle on her breast and decided to see what it was.

"Hm, what's this?" questioned Malon as she looked at her left breast, Saria's green hair and clothes made a great contrast against Malon's red hair. At first, Malon thought it was a piece of grass that was on her chest, but she realised that such a small piece of grass wouldn't have made her felt anything. After seeing some miniscule movement from the green stick, Malon thought it must'vebeen a bug, and she decided to be a bit playful with the poor thing. "Oh my, how did you end up in my bath little one? You must've fell in when I wasn't looking. I won't hurt'cha, but you did peep on me during my private time so you gotta make up for that. " Malon playfully giggled as she grab the towel next to her. Saria wasn't sure how to feel when Malon first acknowledged her. She first thought Malon might squish her because she was seen as a bug, but Malon's giggle at the end had relieved her a bit.

At least, for a second. Then Saria saw Malon grab a washcloth, dip it in the water, and reach out for her. Saria was terrified, yet she had no strength to swim away from the oncoming cloth. Malon soon grip the bug tightly, yet without enough force to crush it, and proceeded to clean herself with her new bug culprit in tow. Saria was surrounded by white cloth all around her and she was trapped. She could only hope that Malon was merciful and release her or even help her soon enough, but first she would have to survive Malon's cleaning. Malon wipe the cloth all over her body. She wiped down both her arms, cleaned her face and neck (while being careful that she didn't swallow the bug by accident, she washed her breasts and stomach the moving towards her back and rear. She was careful not to lose the bug when she cleaned her privates with the towel by slowly moving over then. She then slid the cloth down her legs individually all the while having a playful thought on her head. "This bug is getting to see and feel somethin' that most folks would only dream of. I hope it's a little happy in there" ahe thought with a playful smirk on her face.

When it came time to clean her hair, Malon had put the towel on the floor and made sure the bug was inside, and she cleaned her long hair with her hands and nails running rigorously to make sure all of it was clean. It's a good thing that Saria was in the towel for if she wasn't, then she'dhave to dodge a hailstorm of dirt and dandruff coming from Malon's hair, which would have been near impossible for a fully awake Saria much less a dead tired one. When Malon had decided to leave her sanctuary to take care of the bug, she got a larger towel to dry herself off with and she had carefully slid the bug into an empty bottle. While she didn't want to hurt the bug, Malon was curious about what kind of bug it was. She took the bottle and her dirty clothes and went back to her room to investigate the new bug prisoner.
1321121221122.title: A washbin filled willed soap and a towel next t...

choices: Stayed in the pocket and enjoyed her dinner.
Fell out of the pocket to become part of dinner.
13211212211221.content:
Malon tightly wrapped the towel around her body and quickly walked towards her room to wear her nightgown. As she stepped out of the farmhouse, the setting sun had gleaned across the farm, making Malon's skin seem to glow softly. Saria was in awe at staring at the glowing beauty from the glass bottle and felt a little more at ease from being saved from the hurricane of a bath. Talon was alerted to Malon's arrival as the front door opened, revealing his little girl in a minimal outfit. "Hey Darlin' you'd best get some clothes on and get ready for supper." Talon said as he embraced his daughter. "M'kay Daddy, I'll hurry." Malon replied in a jovial manner and ran upstairs to her room..

Upon reaching her room, Malon had place the bottled bug on her desk and placed her dirty outfit in the hamper near her door. She removed her towel, leaving Saria flustered yet again witnessing the bear goddess before her. Malon duck under her bed in search of a magnifying glass, giving Saria a very generous view of the farmgirl's supple behind. "Couldn't she put on clothes first?" Saria asked out of embarrassment of seeing everything Malon had as plain as day. When Malon found the magnifying, she stood straight up, giving her little mountains and her hair a bounce as she skyrocketed into the heaven's from Saria's perspective. Saria was once again floored by the stature of the large girl and the view straight ahead of her cavern that was large enough to swallow the kokiri girl whole. Saria was beet-red and paralysed from the view she was sure boys like Mido would kill for.

"Now, let's see what kinda bug you are little guy." Malon mused as she bent over her desk to see her bottled guest and decide what she should do with it. Saria tried not to stare at the hanging mountains as Malon bent down and instead looked skyward to the giant eye looking down at her. She tried to wave her arms to show Malon that she was a person and not an insect. Malon looked down at the bug and noticed some peculiar thing about it. She saw the bug wave its two front legs above its head, and they were creamed colored and looked like arms. She noticed its head was shaped in a bowl like fashion with tusks that resembled bangs. She saw a slightly fuzzy body that looked like clothes, girl clothes at that with two very tiny indents on the chest region. Finally, Malon saw the face which looked almost like a human girl's face. "Huh, you look like a tiny person little bug." Malon observed,which then turned to shock as she saw the bug furiously not its head. "Wait... are you... are you nodding?" Malon inquired. She received another nod. "So that means that... you ARE a person?!" Malon cried receiving more nodding from the 'bug-girl.' "Oh wow, ain't that something." Malon saw the girl turn her head, and a quick look at herself revealed why.

"KYYYAAAAAA!!!" Malon shrieked and jump backward to her dresser as she realised that she was plume naked in front of another person, feeling a massive amount of heat rushing to her cheeks. ""Malon! What's going on up there?!" Talon yelled after hearing his daughter shriek in fear. "It's nothing Daddy, I just saw a bug in ma room." Malon replied, not wanting to alarm her father of her freaky discovery. "Awe Darlin' I thought you was tougher than that. Well, you better hurry up cause dinner's almost ready." "Okay Daddy." Saria recoiled as the yelling was too much for her mini ears to handle. Malon quickly slipped on a nightgown to save face and try to talk with her micro guest. "H...hel...llo there." Malon mumbled as she felt flustered by unwittingly revealing herself. "My name is Ma...Malon. What's yours?" Saria tried to say her name but her voice couldn't reach her giantess houstess's ears. "Oh, right, guess you're too far for me ta hear. Hmmm... I got an idea, but ya need to trust me, kay?" Saria nodded as she really didn't have a choice in the matter and she wanted to find someone to help her get back to normal. Malon slowly tilted the bottle horizontally and flattened her palm out near the bottle's opening. Saria walked along the bottle staring at Malon's concerned and warm gaze as she trekked to the hand platform.

A quick hop off the bottle and a small twitch of the hand let Malon know that the bug-girl landed safely. She carefully lifted her hand up to her ear to listen to the little girl's story. "I'M SARIA." Saria raised her voice to hopefully sound clear to the giantess farmgirl. "Nice ta meet'cha." Malon whispered not wanting to break the forest girl's ears. "Now, how'd ya end up in ma bath in the firstplace?" Saria recounted the events that led to this, from playing the song of the minish to surviving a rapid that was a small stream to almost being crushed by a fellow Kokiri girl to riding a bird all the way to the farm. Malon gasped, cooed and tried to comfort the little one as best as she could. "Awe, poor like thing, I just wanna hug you and make you feel alright." Malon then brought her hands to her ample chest to hug her little friend. Saria wasn't uncomfortable, in fact the warmth of the giant hill made her feel a bit better about her situation.

"Dinner's ready! Ya better get sum grub 'fore is gone!" Talon cried out. "Okay Daddy I'm coming." "Say Saria, are ya feeling hungry?" Malon asked bringing the pint-sized girl back to her ear. Saria's body responded by growling loud enough for Malon to hear, and Malon giggled a bit. "Well, I'll be honoured for you to join, but we can't let Daddy know about'cha, it'd be too complicated to explain." Malon looked about her outfit and saw a great hiding spot: a chest pocket on her gown. "Hold on lil missy, are get ready for a ride." Malon tilted her hand towards her pocket, causing Saria to scream of laughter followed by some laughs after she landed in the rather small pocket. It only reached up to Saria's waist, which would have given her away had Malon not been wearing a green nightgown. As she headed downstairs, Malon smelled the roasted cuccoo that Talon made for both of them and she sat down to eat. When Talon was looming, Malon cut up a small piece and handed it to Saria. The head-sized piece of cuccoo had added some extra weight to the pocket that could send Saria overboard and into Malon's drink below. Saria...
